eST4VI7OTIvgXfu8odkibA.text: If I could give zero stars I would. I've had the pleasure of eating their food once at the Albemarle location. It was good. What isn't good is telling customers at 5:40 you're not seating anyone else after 6. The restaurant closes at 8. If I show up almost 2.5 hours before closing to be told the only way they'll take my order is to go something needs to change. Why stop seating 2 hours before close? Make that clear on your website so people like myself don't waste their time, energy, and gas to get there!!!! The consolation prize offered was I could get it go. By the time I get home all my food will be cold and I'm not paying $60 to eat crab legs in my car in your parking lot surrounded by weeds. Get your service right. Your food is amazing but it's not worth it to be turned away.

7Rsf54ad-mkSM24N6kwjlg.text: Third time visiting  here. First time at the new location. Each time it was unorganized unfortunately. This last time the floors were so wet it didn't make any sense . I asked why the floors were wet being that they opened at 11am but it was about 1pm. The response was that they had a spill...... so the entire building something spilled? From the front door to the back, to the bathrooms ? Seemed like the shift the night before didn't clean. One of the hostess picked someone kid up to make sure they wouldn't fall because the floors were soaking wet. The food is pretty decent. Portion size is inconsistent though. It seems like the take out orders are piled up but dining in you don't get nearly as much for the price . I think once they work some kinks out they have potential to be a nice establishment. One employee literally said something like it's a black restaurant, what you expect ? That was weird. Maybe some training should be in the near future . You should overly exceed expectations black or not. Black is not an indication of lacking as that employee implied . Im rooting for them.

FHxZuJl1bPkjJMW_9U49BQ.text: I don't know what these people use to season up this food, besides butter  but my visit and pricing was well worth it. 2PxtKniPYV7UZvRGUcOR9A.text: While I enjoyed the food, there were some issues that we had. After getting seated in the place, it was informed to us that you were out of crab legs and lobster tails. You really need to plan for a huge crowd every weekend. I suggest taking the amount needed for your biggest platter and make the projection that 75% of your typical amount of customers would order this platter and you would come close to ensuring a great experience for the majority of your customers. Also don't be so lazy even as you near shutting down( it was approximately an hr and a half left to go before 7), that you don't want to clean your fryers and replenish them with fresh oil so your customers food doesn't taste like old grease. 9pzeKiQZ5Ttksm8z_PDotQ.text: The food is tasty, but the customer service is the absolute worst. The restaurant is situated inside ANOTHER restaurant which definitely gave me the side eye & the wait times are extremely long. I doubt if they have a working phone in the entire establishment therefore call in orders are prohibited which is very inconvenient. It would actually cut down on the wait time if call ins or online ordering was accepted. Not sure if I'll be returning.

b8YaypSMR3cYJrZSc7CgcQ.text: New to Charlotte so trying different restaurants.   We thought we'd try seafood.  This place was up the street so we thought we'd check it out.   Crab legs were good.  Fried shrimp was pretty dried out and tasted like breaded chicken, probably due to the thick coating of cornmeal/batter & having to cook it too long??   Fried fish barely had fish..mostly cornmeal/batter.  They did bring me a grilled piece which was much better.  A lot of spices/herbs but it was ok.  Fries seasoned way too much & weren't fresh.  Hush puppies were just ok.  For a $40 meal we were faaaar from impressed.  Once served we had to waived down anyone we could find for drink refills. With the loud music (which was actually good selection) I felt like I was out clubbing.  Watch for the slippery painted floor...don't wear heels, you'll leave with a broken ankle!  I won't be back.  Not impressed. Gets a 2 only because crab legs & tea were good.

AsZCU6Ib_ZR_Y-x6RWB4Ew.text: Just ate at this place for the first time today. My husband and I were in town for the Earth, Wind and Fire concert and we found the spot on Yelp.  The food offerings reminded us of a place in the Atlanta, Ga area called What's Crackin. They do garlic crabs and shrimp boils and serve large portions.  Seafood Connection was not nearly as good in comparison. We had the Super C Port, which was $65.  The shrimp was mushy... normally my favorite... but i ate only one.  The crabs and lobster were fair. There was only 1 piece of sausage in the plate and 2 pieces of corn.  And the rest of the plate was potatoes.  Perhaps my view is skewed because What's Crackin has better food and a better value for the money. Seafood Connection was okay but we won't go back.  If you are in the ATL, check out What's Crackin on Candler Road and you will "taste" the difference and your meal will be less expensive but still very filling with seafood, more sausage and corn versus potatoes.

qGD7KAz89N_z44q_CzMO7w.text: I have tried Seafood Connection twice and picked up food for others a couple of times. Located inside another restaurant King of Spicy whose food is horrible but I digress. Why share a kitchen in such a horrible restaurant? It seems so dirty. With so much hype, I still decided to go for it. I ordered the fish and crab rice. It was just Ok. The second time, I ordered salmon... just Ok. I didn't even finish it. The food is overpriced if you ask me and they use a LOT salt, and spread not real butter. Customer service is lacking. The girl took my order and once I paid I decided to just go with the combo and she told me it was too late my order was sent to the kitchen already. It had been a split second, nobody else in line, she could have gone out of the way if she wanted to. For these reasons I most likely won't eat there again. But just so the business knows, I have referred about 5 people that eat there regularly and I wish them luck.

jvssNJdyADsOi9adfRtY3Q.text: I wish I could give a 1.5, but I can't. I'm trying to figure out where these other reviewers ate so I can find this GREAT seafood they're raving about. I have visited this place twice. Fool me once-shame on you. Fool me twice-can't put the blame on you! My first visit I didn't even order because the line was RIDICULOUSLY long, I asked a woman and her adult son how long they waited-she told me 3 hours! WHAT? I'm not even at the DMV for 3 hours. Needless to say, I left. So yesterday *insert face palm emoji* I decided to give it another shot, I had to know if the bark was equivalent to the bite. After waiting, and waiting to order I received dry customer service. After waiting over an hour (for steamed seafood) I asked if I could get my money back, the other patrons were looking at me as if I was insulting their mother. The person at the register kept giving me the run around and magically my food was ready. I saw someone else mention they have a cult following, ha! It's True. I'm sorry but I just can't see spending my hard earned money and waiting long enough to finish half of a Netflix series, time and time again. These people wait for hours on end for a mediocre, at best, dining experience. The food was not all that! I've been cracking crabs, throwing back shrimp, shucking oysters since I was 3! No exaggeration. So I KNOW good seafood. I'm not going to front, it smelled delicious from the box. However, upon opening it I immediately recognized the "butter" as a Parkay type imitation. The shrimp seasoning was nothing but garlic salt-beware if you are a sufferer of high blood pressure. The potatoes were flavorless, sausage under cooked, the eggs and corn were the best part! I'm not hard to please by any means, I've eaten at some sketchy hole-in-the-wall places and received better food and service. If you're thinking of going here, stop...you can prepare a much better seafood boil at home for less $$ and time. Please GET IT TOGETHER, Seafood Connection.

ftOZ1XYDHiVgYY5JxcMKfQ.text: First time here and I was so impressed!!! This is what I have been looking for in crab legs! It's a shame they are only open Friday-Sunday. This is close tie to my favorite place in Daytona beach.  Dangerous as it's in my own town and could find myself here weekly.  I was in and out in under twenty minutes. It's located in an old restaurant and were only serving takeout.

NaoNmpgDbHhD6YhDvCMx_Q.text: Seafood is everything.  I have mastered not waiting forever for food...buttttt even if you have to wait, trust me its worth it.  I have buying food from them since they were pulling up on sunset slanging plates in parking lot.  Def worth the money.  Unique flavor only the connect can offer you .  If you are in charlotte or visiting... make sure you check them out

8CtkjXaT5rcw5mtm7USChQ.text: Very disappointed, if this best Charlotte can do with seafood, I really feel sad, they stopped orders for 15 minutes to catch up, the hostess did offer me tea, after I ask, they are penny pinching these people for one claw, sides 30 dllrs is ridiculous, I tired something cheaper, like the fried fish, you can tell good restaurant if they can fry some fish, it was horrible, everything over price for the quality of food you get, this time of year grab legs are cheap, being from D.C., blue shell crabs are my thing, but this place is not worth the wait or the money, veggie side was a joke, which came with two pieces of small corn, potatoes and small sausage, guess their version New Orleans crab boil all for the price of six dllrs, they charge for everything even extra butter 1 dllrs for small cup, have to laugh because people line up to be rip off, but it's their money, I guess this place is heaven connected to another restaurant Spice King, maybe the food truck would had been better.

--PhNVCFid20yReRS0VDbw.text: Everything at this place taste amazing. So nicely seasoned and you get so much food for your money

zclBHzS1eCiZ3QtDwZRANg.text: Love this place. The food is fantastic yes you will have a wait but it's worth it. Don't go on your lunch hour you may be waiting for a while.The fastest time I got in an out was 35min. Go on a day when you have time to wait. Overall 5 stars.

DqtcMuzsqjPYifamITDzaA.text: I heard about Seafood Connection about a year ago from my ecstatic son. He was apparently visiting a friend when the friend's girlfriend arrived home complaining about the one hour wait to receive good from Seafood Connection. This was when they were first operating out of the church parking lot. She had two orders of the C-note. But once they opened the boxes and started eating, all of that stress melted away. I finally arrived last Friday along with my sister. Their website said the hours were 11:30am-8pm but their Facebook page stated 12pm-8pm. Be sure to check their Facebook page for correct hours. We arrived around 11am after a trip to the Charlotte Regional farmers market and parked in the shade right in front of the King of Spicy bldg. Ppl began pulling up at around 11:30. We quickly got out and entered. There were already two young women sitting around the bar waiting and perusing their phones. So that meant that we were #3 in line. Order time was 12:05, at which point there was probably 20 other ppl there in line behind us. You jump up when the cashier says ok, taking orders now and basically line up around the bar in the order you arrived. We ordered two C-note, one Lock-in, an order of fried shrimp and a order of fried oysters. Total was $121. They have extra butter sauce behind the bar and several ppl ordered it but you really don't need bcuz ur dinner is smothered in the stuff. To end, that C-note was 3 meals for me!! So much food and so fresh and delicious!!!. Ppl will pay for quality and quantity also at Seafood Connection. I'm planning another visit this week. You surely won't be disappointed.

a4xX0JaJXAwaB2bagQrQng.text: I really enjoyed my food from Seafood Connection. It was hot and fresh. I got the C-Port platter and there was so much food my husband and I shared it. The sauce was amazing! I will probably ask for light sauce next time I go because it was a little much for me but I wanted the full experience the first time I went. The best parts of my platter were the corn, potatoes, shrimp and lobster. I was not a fan of the crab legs, but I don't tend to like crab legs anyways (too much work!).  I don't understand people complaining about the wait. The wait is no different than eating at Red Lobster or Olive Garden and their food is prepared to order.  Love this place and will definitely return!

wCwn-Qvo9JNkI3bf8A9ZYw.text: This place is amazingly delicious. We came at a lucky time, there were about 5 people in line ahead of us, the wait to order was about 6 minutes and just enough time for us to decide what we want.  There were 3 of us, my mom and I shared the steamed crab and shrimp meal (forget the name on the menu, it had 2 crab legs and like 12 shrimp) and my stepdad ordered a fried fish platter. They offer water and sweet tea as drink options.   The steamed meal came out first, ahead of the Other meal by about 10 minutes. I took a picture but after my mom scooped a couple shrimp and her crab so it's a little light in the photo but the lid of the container couldn't even close. It was DELICIOUS. Absolutely no way to improve unless they could add something to help break the crab with bc it was a little labor intensive. It could have fed 3-4 people. We left many shrimp and barely got to touch the potato and corn. Everything was amazing.   We didn't pay much attention to my stepdads meal but he said it was delicious and he can be difficult to please so that carries some weight.   Oh my mom just said we ordered the "super combo"

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Super combo. My mom already grabbed a crab and a couple shrimp so those aren&#39;t in the photo. DELISH

y3WQUlT2Pvr5HekvZnruQA.text: I don't eat meat, but it was a friends birthday so I came and attended. Your online menu said you had a veggie plate. I was excited. I get there to find out the veggie plate is a LIE! Not only does you "veggie plate" come with pork sausage, but it also doesn't have any veggies. Who are you trying to fool? Potato is not a vegetable, corn is not a vegetable and PORK SAUSAGE is not a vegetable. I then asked if I could do a substitute broccoli and take off the sausage and they said no. You guys suck. You False advertise a veggie plate and don't allow anyone to make any changes. Now, my meat eating friends all said the crab legs, shrimp and fish were amazing, but their only complaint was that the floors were sticky and the roof was leaking. Most of us decided we will not dine there again. I suggest doing a simple google search and learn what a vegetable is.

V8BoSMEa79BDqOXhBwLY7A.text: Overrated. I'm from the lowcountry and I lived in Maryland. I know seafood. The food was cold, too cold for the 1 hour wait to be seated and the 30 min wait to eat. I am not sure if they season the food at all. They lather it with butter sauce which to me tastes like cheap margarine. I really do not understand why everyone is going crazy over this food. Maybe I ordered the wrong?!? We got the super combo with an order of hushpuppies.  The hushpuppies were the savory kind. They had onions in them. They were overcooked and not good at all.   The potatoes were mushy and not classic red potatoes which are what should be used in Frogmore Stew. The corn tasted the best. There was one ity bity sausage in each of our boxes.   The shrimp wasn't anything special. They were large and plentiful. They were also streamed and drowned in fake butter. My crabs were soooo bland. They were cold and tasteless.   Service was okay. I can tell that they are understaffed.   Experienced seafood cooks/eaters can totally do this yourself. It's way too overpriced for the disappointment.

v5lvTEmxzXOy929VJhLzhw.text: The food is really good, BUT the service is subpar.  I pray this establishment last, but tighten up your staff. I sat on the side of the bar for 45 min and my food had been sitting behind the bar for at least 20.  The servers forgot to call my name.   Thanks to the manager for switching out my cold food for fresh food.

ppXm-TqVXnTG6LvcCKqS3A.text: Mediocre food Long lines  Poor customer service  Go there when they first open because they seem to run out of certain things   A little in the salty side

Kgo5TDvykkgyQ3rHoYwoSQ.text: Visit Date: 3/10/2018  First time here after all the Hype around Charlotte about this place   FOOD & SERVICES: I had the C-Port Platter for $40 with extra butter sauce. IT WAS REALLY GOOD!! OMG WAS IT GOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Now I was gonna eat it the restaurant. It was a very long wait for my food which I understand. BUT when I got my food, parts of my crabs was cold and the shrimp was mins away from also being cold, I don't mind waiting for my food because I know it's freshly cooked BUT WHEN MY FOOD COMES AND ITS NOT HOT AND I HAVE WAITED 30 MINS PLUS FOR MY FOOD THATS A PROBLEM. Mind you at that time I was going to dine in. The waitress took my food back to warm it back up and I asked her to just bag it up to go. The service to the table is a bit slow. I don't think each service have certain tables because about 2 to 3 different PPL stop it my table and asked have someone helped(which is a good thing). Now would I go back ......YES I WILL HANDS DOWN! I HAVE ALREADY PLANNED THE DATE LOL. Hopefully things will be better. Everyone have off days.   INSIDE: it's pretty big and they have their logo on all the tables. It's a pretty good vibe. They have a good music playing. Yes the lines are long. When I got there it was just like 5 people ahead of me BUT when I was leaving (around 3:30 ish) that line was OUT THE DOOR! They also have a stage. I wonder if they have ppl preforming there sometimes?   THE PROCESS: You pay for your food at front when you walked in (thats why the line is long like that). It would be helpful if it's your first time, to look at the menu before getting there, so it will help the line move faster. After you pay, the host will take you to your table. Then you will get your food. Now the food is cooked when your order. So keep in mind that it's not fast food. If you are in a rush you might want to call in your order and get it to go. They will bring your food in a Togo box (yes even if you dine in). Which is cool especially if you don't eat all your food.   TOGO ORDER: YES YOU STILL HAVE TO STAND IN THAT LINE. BUT YOU WILL GO TO THE BAR TO PICKUP YOUR ORDER.

VP1PoWa3NhN4bQUSVhv1nA.text: The food was so good! I asked for light sauce cause I'm not a huge melted butter fan. They've added spices to the mix abs it's delicious. For the price you get plenty of food.

fL2dVQJ5n8fj6_UvDbf-Rg.text: This restaurant is so ghetto and unprofessional ! The music was so loud playing rap music, I could not hear myself think! The waiters has to bend to your face to place your order. When ask the manager  can you please turn down the music speaker above my head she stated no it's All Star weekend. Wow! I received my food an hour late. I asked the waitress where was my food she said it's alway an hour to get your food. Oh boy ! When  I finally get my so called Super boat it was flooded with butter and garlic ! Every place I ever eaten seafood the butter was served on the side ! They poured all  that butter and garlic right on top. I almost threw up in my paper plate ! Lastly, I asked the waiter upfront how much was my order he stated 65 dollars . When I got my bill is was 75 plus an 18% gratuity! I ask the waitress about the 10 dollar difference and she said It's All Star weekend we increased the prices ! Not telling the customers, isn't price gauging against the law ! They don't ever have to worry about me coming back ! I traveled this entire  country and this restaurant was the worst horrible place I ever experienced!

956Lr1VcMIY4mn7PQh7pfQ.text: Nom, nom and more nom. Seafood is amazing. Several in my group didn't want the abundance of butter and seasoning so I Google searched re-steaming crab legs, shrimp, etc. I brought a large pot of with 1" of water with rack to a boil (make foil balls if don't have a rack for the pot you have) and placed crab legs, shrimp and corn on the rack but above the water for 3-5 minutes (do not place items in boiling water -- must be placed above water for steaming). The excess butter and seasoning melted off and was then buttered and seasoned perfectly. I dream of this place. What a find.

BKeGXIjX2_3Kch32i4sftQ.text: It was my first time going here at I was very curious about if the food was as good as I was told because the line was very long I mean wrapped around the building long but after waiting on line for about an hour it actually was worth the wait if you are planning on checking them get there an hour before they open or you will be waiting they only let a certain amount of people in at a time an security at the door is tight like you will b waiting to get inside but all in all the food was worth the wait and the price wasnt to bad a little expensive but it's not bad

XO6VIpvyH79rf4PDtmgb4Q.text: Please implement a better system for entering the restaurant and placing a takeout order. Are y'all going to have ppl stand out in the cold to get inside when it's not even packed in here? Other than that, the food is great!

XZHefNDIqyJttLNeYuBuOw.text: All though the food might look tasty and they are quite popular online, it's almost impossible to even get into this place!! I've come here from almost 45 minutes away 3 TIMES ALREADY!!! and was not able to get in once! All they say when you get there is "we don't have anymore room" or "you should of called" like we didn't try to call before and they LITERALLY never pick up (not even exaggerating we called 9 times) they really need to work on the hours of this place because they "shut down" due to said complications, which I find highly unprofessional. EqqxepAZLwFlrrRs9GDq3g.text: Poor service, not enough cooks in kitchen but they outside smoking, the wait time to be seated was horrible, not having half of the menu available, and had children as the hostess/busting table. I end up leaving and having dinner at the restaurant next door.

h7ALyCfeZ-GwnhfTFXkXzA.text: Definitely worth the hype and wait!! The butter sauce is so flavorful and the seafood was huge. Yum!

okCCqeLo7q4R0TOvzVFjew.text: Seafood Connection has an awesome product in their food. What I may say is that the service is lacking overall. If patrons are to wait an hour to two hours for food, it should be piping hot when you receive it. Most of our food was room temperature or cold when we got it. I never saw any type of manager or leader running the restaurant. We had to eat with plastic forks and knives. How do you eat crab legs with plastic forks. When I asked the waitress, which was excellent, for a fork she said she could not find one. There were no lemons. They had lemonade on the menu but was out. I leave this review not as a critique but to push owners to do better.

-wEDJuuYlBeHpR7Mxk_hNA.text: First time Visiting...We get here soon as they open on Sunday 11am. We walked over to the Hostess she takes your order & you pay. We ordered Shrimp combo & Shrimp tacos an item on the Sunday special You're given a number sign to leave on the table you choose to sit at. Our food arrived in a timely manner. Hostess & Waitress was very nice. The food was delicious. I'll come back to order the grilled or steamed platters. The music was a little loud in the restaurant. While placing our order the hostess had to walkie~talkie them in the back to lower it down...so she could hear her customers. But a great experience over all. For dine in Everything is packed in to go boxes brought to you,styrofoam cups. Condiments on the table are single packets of sauces, plastic packaging of utensils, wet wipes for your hands. And I get it all easy clean up no dishwashing!

T0MTDOuTOUWHUec99Uz1RQ.text: I heard about Seafood Connection through FB and Instagram.I did not order a platter as my appetite was not that big that day so I ordered some shrimp and seafood salad.The seafood salad did not meet my expectations.In my opinion,it was too salty and had too much going on.The shrimp were really big and juicy.However,the shrimp didn't have any seasoning on them or taste.I also wasn't that crazy about the butter sauce that everyone talks about.I think it may have been more appetizing on a platter which I will be trying next time.If you haven't been before they are operating out of another restaurant.I must say though,they have it very organized and business runs smoothly.They have wonderful customer service and polite attitudes.This was all through my observations as I waited in line.I was impressed!

ICtQlmPLuRhPWnlDOq6F8w.text: Very poor customer service for to go order you can wait up to one hour. They should respect time

V5z9MSrMfeqK9IHgw16xww.text: Let me start off by saying that it truly hurts my heart to have to write this review. I've wanted to visit this restaurant for so long and the whole experience fell way below what I've heard and what I expected. I'm constantly out of town on the weekends due to my career so when I saw through their instagram that they would be open on a thursday, I made sure I was one of many waiting at the doors before they even opened. A close friend I decided to go with has been here several times and has raved about how great the food is every time. After waiting about 10 minutes past opening time, they opened the doors to begin serving everyone. If you're dining in, let this be a warning that they do not take refunds and you MUST pay before you take a seat. This also means you MUST order. The menu isn't too huge, so it shouldn't take you long. I decided to get the steamed C-Port Platter (Comes with 1 cluster of crabs, 1 lobster, 10-12 jumbo shrimp, potatoes, corn, & sausage). It came out to a total of $43 that I would soon regret spending. As soon as we sat down, our waitress verified our orders on the receipt and took our drink orders. My friend & I both ordered waters. After 10 minutes, the water were brought to us. My friend then proceeded to ask for lemons for her water. The waitress told us that she would check to see if they had any. After she walked away, my friend & I looked at each other confused thinking the same exact thing. What kind of SUCCESSFUL seafood restaurant doesn't have lemons??? After our waitress "looked" for the lemons and couldn't "find" them, she returned & said these words verbatim, *nods head as approaching the table* "We don't have any lemons, if I could go to food lion & get them for you I would". We said okay and she continued to address a table behind us. It was clearly a friend of hers as they exchanged hugs and a couple of giggles. This customer came after us, received his food before us, AND received lemons with his drink + food WITHOUT having to ask. Before the runner that delivered his food could return to the kitchen I stopped him and asked for a few lemons as well. As he returned to the kitchen, You could clearly see from our table where the lemons were. He cut a few and brought them to us immediately. A few minutes later we received our food and I regret not taking a picture. I felt so cheated compared to what they advertise on instagram. I was expecting a savory sauce and instead received a dry rub on everything. To make matters worse, my lobster and shrimp were overcooked. They both tasted mushy yet gritty due to the seasoning carelessly thrown on top. The only positive thing that I can say is that you can tell the seafood was fresh. After barely eating my food I was completely ready to go. We stopped by the counter to tell the young lady about our experience. She was so helpful & tried her best to reconcile the issue. Apparently many people are complaining about their over use of the savory sauce I've seen on instagram which is why the food was as it was. She sent us off with apologies and new lobster tails & shrimp. Sad to say, they tasted the exact way of what I complained about. I appreciate the young lady at the front for at least trying to fix the issue. If my waitress was half as customer service oriented as she was, I would've actually reconsider revisiting.

00m6uIXm5mdXw43G80jv-A.text: OMG!!! Some of the BEST seafood I have ever had! Just the right amount of seasoning on everything. I had the crab plate which consisted of 2 crab clusters, 2 ears of corn, potatoes and sausage. Desmond was very personable and entertaining! We will be returning the next time we're in Charlotte.

XfnQwtOc4Is-8AQZzIKRdg.text: Note: This review is not to bash the establishment because I love this place, and I will return. I just want to make them aware what seems to be a sore. MY FOOD WAS AWESOME!! I placed my to go order with 4 other ladies. When the food was brought out, everyone received theirs except for me. I didn't make a big deal out of it, but of course I was curious to know what the hold up was. The lady who was handing out the to go orders (kim) I believe her name was, was absolutely nonchalant. I tried to grab her attention, and she actually rolled her eyes and put her finger up *YIKES*. Before she came over to me, she went to the back to grab more orders (orders of people who had ordered after me).When she finally came over, I told her the situation, and she looked and rolled her eyes again and said, "I just give the orders out, I'll have to find someone that can find your order." By this time I was absolutely confused.. how hard would it have been to go simply ask the kitchen to research a lost ticket? I actually did not even care to deal with her at this point (it was a beautiful Saturday, and GOD knows I have changed my ways). So I then got the attention of the cashier who took our order. SHE WAS THE BOMB (beautiful brown skinned girl with a hat on and a bob). She actually got off the register went to the back and came back LESS than a minute later with my order. I asked her "what is that lady's problem?" (I was referring to the kim lady). She (Cashier lady) just shook her head, and smiled. I took that as she may simply have an attitude problem. Other people noticed and commented to me while I stood there, so I know it wasn't just me.  She (kim) may need a morale booster, because she seemed to hate her job. ** just an observation**  I pray this business grows bigger than the owner even knows, but she needs to be talked to.

gFKG1UjDBAO7nEbCO4Pl3A.text: This was my second time going. And the same things happened during both occasions, we had over a 45 minute wait which was fine because it was obviously crowded, then once we were seated the waiter took a while to come over and get our drinks. As we began to order, two of us mentioned to add a side of scallops and she goes "oh we're out of scallops and oysters" mind you it was only 2:30. Once we ordered it took another 45 minutes for the food to come out. I swear they try to play that loud music to distract you from how long you wait. Once our food did arrive it was as if it had been sitting out for a bit, was barely warm; though i know crab can cool down quick i still expected things to be warmer. We then had to ask for crab crackers 10 min into eating b/c we just assumed that the waiter would bring it. Our waiters on both occasions were great nonetheless. Food was good as well. The business has a lot of minor things to improve on however. And the parking lot was not only a mess, with trash but it also smelled of rotten seafood.

OWd7SRy4Fr_BLayz7J2LUQ.text: I got the combo c. It had crabs shrimp and crawfish I believe. Also came with corn and potatoes. Flavors consisted of garlic and blender consult in abundance. The bottom of tray had at least a half an inch of butter. It was a lot of food but I don't know if it was about $40 worth. I will try another dish again be prepared for a long wait.

rEKDeLuPBl2oAvsrbtF3Yg.text: I have a love-hate relationship with seafood connection. Sometimes my food is absolutely delicious and sometimes it falls short of expectations. I usually order the crab platter and most of the time it's absolutely delicious, actually even addicting. However recently I tried brunch and I ordered the crab cakes. The crabcakes tasted like it had too much sugar and mustard in them. I couldn't even eat a whole crab cake because of the strong flavor. However the grits were absolutely delicious. The waffles weren't homemade, it seemed like they were made with a box mix. Very dry and disappointing. I will continue to visit seafood connection my crab fix and that's about it!

IJP2xY_GZRdJBPbWKt6vHg.text: The best in town I love this seafood place not to far from where I live the food is off the hook.Love my Crab Legs yummy

YQlbrnRoOK7DPgu51ey8EA.text: ***I was not able to try the food, so I am only reviewing the facility***After hearing rave reviews of this pop up kitchen/hole in the wall, I thought I would give it a try. I made sure to come early in the day thanks to my other Yelpers who let me know that they run out of things quickly. I was a little alarmed that when we went to walk up to the register to order, we were yelled at and told to wait behind a line about 6 feet away until we were called over. Then, when we were called up we noticed a bouncer by the cashier....which is a little concerning, but let me remind you that this is a hole in the wall, and hey! hole in walls often have the best food. Well, everything myself and my group wanted to order was sold out. EVERYTHING. Also, this is cash only AND the ATM was broken....which made a lot of people leave. The food is pricey, but it is seafood. However, due to being a hole in the wall, you do expect a little cheaper prices. We were unable to order ANYTHING we wanted and it was only 11 am.... they were very unapologetic, so we did not have a great experience this time but I would love to come again to try it. There must be a reason it was all sold out, right?!

RKx2ilCU8BuvEsTzcgnbUg.text: This place lived up to the hype. Best seafood I've ever had in my life, hands down. I don't know what they use to make their "special sauce" but I crave it weekly. Some may complain about the atmosphere and styrofoam plates the food comes in, but I work for an up and coming local business myself so I respect the hustle. Can't wait to watch this business grow.

sofpdW5fC2wBXAPVplkEbQ.text: Very unprofessional!   I waited outside for 1hr. To come into a restaurant full of empty tables this is not a efficiently running "restaurant" it is still being run like the food truck it use to be.

RKLFxME-zqAHch77XsY0Jw.text: I was told to check them out, so I did.  Went once and won't be going back, the food overall was somewhat good but I'm not paying anyone those kind of prices to be given plastic eating utensils and have my food delivered to the table in a take out styrofoam container.  I was told that this restaurant used to be run from a food truck, so OK I would expect that type of service.  But once you move into a sit down establishment and charge prices like that, you need to step it up, presentation is everything. The fork that you're given is the cheap ones that you get at the chinese take-out places (fork, knife and mini napkin in a plastic bag).  Are they serious? I asked my server, "is this what I'm supposed to eat with"?, and she said that was all they had. (WOW).  My total bill was $42.22 before tip and that was just for myself.  If you want to patronize them and pay big bucks like that to eat out of styrofoam go right ahead.  When I dine out and pay over $50 with tip, I want to feel pampered and Seafood Connection doesn't pamper you.  I'll head to Harris Tweeter and grab me some crab legs and make them in my kitchen for a lot cheaper and I can throw in a bottle of wine and I still haven't hit $50 bucks! And I'll feel pampered!

K54ec5GNPpkqznr4_7v5WQ.text: Giving one star because I came to try this place out that everyone's been raving about and didn't have any luck bc I had to wait outside with a baby ..... like they have to get a better system working with the dine in and take out. There is one line for both. Not pleased but I hope to try the food one day. I'll give them one more shot but it's not the easiest with a baby. Oh there is no phone number so i couldn't call in if I wanted to.

p-EY-VJ7IPXv4zeVxiSiPQ.text: Honestly I wish I could give them no stars! I never leave reviews but this restaurant has been weighing on me since yesterday. I had been telling myself for weeks that I was going to make time to visit their new location being that they are in the university area now. I waited until my day off which was Friday to visit and was sure to get there exactly when they opened which was 11:am just so I wouldn't have to wait. There was one person ahead of me and we both were taken care of quickly. I ordered 2 fried shrimp and fish plates with hush puppy and fries, a pint of crab rice and pepper and onions. My order was $50. As I waited I noticed others were gradually coming through the door. 20 min goes by and the one guy before gets his food & leave. At this point it's me and like 4 other people waiting. Another 15 min go by and 3 people get their food. So at this point 35 has went by and the lady had the nerve to say that fried food takes longer as if it really takes 35 min to cook fried seafood. I felt like my ticket had been lost or something. At this point 5 more people has came in and their orders were taken. I lie to you not, another 15 min goes by and the young lady goes to back and comes back out with everyone's order, this time including mine. My order was WRONG so I asked to speak to a manager immediately. He comes out and hears me out and ask me if I wanted another plate. I told him that I've already waited 50 min. I won't wait any longer. Then he mentioned to the cashier to give me 20% off my next order and walked away. He did not care to apologize. The cashier decided 25% would be better as if I planned to come back which I do not so I declined and told her I'll take the plate that the manager offered so I can be on my way. She goes to the back and brings out a plate with crab legs, steamed shrimp, corn and some other things. They didn't care to ask me what I wanted. At this point, I am so upset. I could cry. I felt so disrespected. The audacity! I do not even eat crab legs! Had I not talked to my boyfriend I would have requested a refund for sure but I just took the food and left. I felt like my energy had been drained. When I got home, I wasn't even hungry but I ate because my bf paid for it. I had to saute the rice and peppers and onions with teriyaki island sauce cause they both were bland and the rice had too much pepper. I was very disappointed and will never go there again. Had those other 10 people not gotten their food before me, I probably wouldn't have been so upset cause I know how the wait there can be but I was there when the doors opened and was the second to order my food and was the 11th person to get their food. It's no excuse. The establishment cares nothing about customer service or customer complaints.

hCaTdtZCYCAtPVZOIP2D1w.text: My Seafood soul looks back and wonders..... How did I survive before i was connected to the seafood connection? Food so good, I saw a lady almost stab her sister who was reaching for a shrimp!!!!  Only 1 word describes the flavor... #Rediculous!!!! Crazy good food, decent price, definitely worth the wait. Everything is good but my absolute favorite is the C-port platter (10-12 shrimp, crab leg cluster, and 1 lobster tail (best fried), with potatoes, corn, and a boiled egg (if your lucky) dipped in the "special seasonings"... $40. I went to Publix and tried to recreate this box of bold taste and it costs me over $100 and the great taste of Seafood Connection. Never Again! I encourage you to TREAT YO SELF!!! and eat everything you can.... #Yummy2MyTummy #JustMelApproved

enmKL-bwPnfissdVARXKaQ.text: My wife and I decided to try out the Seafood Connection restaurant, after hearing great things.  I had the grilled flounder, and she had the crab legs and shrimp.  The food was great, and we could have easily shared one order.  You definitely get a healthy serving of great tasting food.  I did want to try the scallops, but they were not available except on weekends.  Our food was ready in about 15 minutes or less.  There is a bar area, but doesn't serve alcohol at this point.  We did takeout, but there were plenty of tables available, had we decided to eat in. You do put your order in at the front, but that was no issue.   Of course on weekends that might not be the case, based on the volume of business this place gets.  We were very pleased overall, and the staff treated us perfectly.

hCWjgQxqE1Cwn_s-dnrBrg.text: Where to begin? I went to their pop up location on Friday at camp North end. This was my second time eating here, the first time I grabbed the food from King of Spicy. I brought a lot of friends with me this time and while the food got there after the line formed it was still just as good as the first time (and just as good as all the pictures! We all thoroughly enjoyed it and love that butter sauce! Even though we were pretty messy we really loved it! I can't wait until I go back! We each got shrimp and crab plates!

o01Jf9SPBJszjDNOSIsMMA.text: We dined at seafood connection on Saturday. Sure it was CIAA weekend so we were already expecting a wait. We arrived and we were seated as soon as we walked in the door. Our waitress was new and she was very pleasant. She took our drink orders and then came back to take our food orders. We placed our orders around 220. Around 330 were wondering where our food is. Another waitress with an ipad comes over as she has noticed we have been sitting there for quite some time and ask did anyone take our order. We tell her yes and she ask did they put it in the ipad and did we pay. We didnt because no one told us that was part of the policy. So we asked for a manager. The manager/owner from what she told us attitude about fixing the problem was ill put a rush on it. We asked her if anything would be taken off of the bill or if she would compensate us with an appetizer or extra food or just any thing for the inconvenience and her answer was a stern no. We advised that it was a very pleasant experience to see multiple tables of people who came in after us eating and we were still sitting there. We advised that since our waitress was new someone should have been making sure she knew how things worked. Her response was DONT TIP HER!   This really upset me. Cuz as a business owner you should want to make sure your employees are doing a good job and are happy. It also upset me because she wanted to make sure she was getting all of her money but didnt care if her server was paid. At that point i was done.  We waited another 10-15 mins for our food and i cant even lie the food was good. It was very flavorful, the only downside was it was sitting in a pool of butter.

ln9J_xYUwbs8cjLJla4Zcg.text: The food is great and by far the best seafood I've had in Charlotte. The business is growing and the service seem to be improving. I have waited 40 minutes before, my last visit even with several customers before me I got me food in half the time. This is a cash only restaurant, but they have an ATM in the front of the restaurant. Even though you can dine in, I always take my food home. And each time, I find they left something out. Every platter comes with corn, potatoes and sausage, I have been short a sausage or corn nothing major like a crab leg so I will still return. The portions are huge so you can share or have leftovers. They are only open Friday, Saturday and Sunday which sucks because they are so good, I can eat there everyday. If you are a seafood lover this would definitely be a great spot.

9uOU4q5mieRLQi3eQIMRsw.text: I love this place .. now you can sit down and enjoy your meal .. I've been following them from the church to the new home which is gorgeous.. A Must for great seafood

KSOBu0sJVu8rX9wYQqVmqg.text: The food is good but the service is horrible. It was 30 minutes to order and 39 minutes wait to get my food.

qKxHe1u2EDmdRUCMtVIKmQ.text: Hooah; originally was planning to dine at an Asian restaurant, however; they were closed Easter Sunday. I looked at my YELP APP, check Seafood & discovered Seafood Connection had 4 Stars ( underrated, should be 5+). Great photo of meals, wife saw Giant Crabs Legs; Shrimp, Corn ) served but not shown was sausage & potatoes) and said let's go there. This is my first time EVER writing a Review, that enough should tell you This place, the food, the service & price were all worthy of the highest compliments one could think of. My wife was even making sounds I've never heard before. I must tell all ; go check this place out. It's worth the trip, also it was my wife birthday and we went after the Hornets game. My wife said next time we go to a Panthers game we will stop bye also. My compliments to Seafood Connection & it's employees .

tuJ2q5Ut6FTyGOffbm2Mtg.text: So I am a fan from the parking lot days pull up pull up pull up!  My usual is the shrimp plate.  It's delicious and solidly two meals for me.  It's corn, potatoes (hello carbs) and 10 or so peel and eat shrimp along with beef sausage and a boiled egg.  The flavor and freshness is on point - yes it can be greasy but note you can ask them to go easy on spices and/or butter.  But why??  I budget this meal into my new healthy lifestyle.  Prices are fair and I've never had issue with customer service.    My first visit to the new location in King of Spicy was Easter (Yes they were open Easter!).  I get the bouncer for security but it was still off putting.  There must be  a lot of cash floating around as it's an all cash venture at this point.  The snow crab clusters are also the bomb.  I'm so happy to see this place thriving.  I've noticed a definite uptick in professionalism too since the addition of Yeshika and Von Juan,  Both of these folks manage the social media and are always engaging - taking the good and the bad.  Only reason I didn't give five stars is my ONE beef.  I'd pay more for deviened shrimp.  I budget for the calories, but still have issue getting over the lack of deviening.  That being said the shrimp last time was perfectly cooked and not mealy.  Just i don't wanna eat shrimp poop.  Sorry to be gross.

5gcfcRskZ0B8hHFe0sqpPg.text: Food is decent. The sauce is tasty but yet salty. I have not had the fried plates but I was a little turned off because they don't devein the shrimp. As I was peeling mine I could see the brown oozing out of the end of the shrimp..... gross. It also took nearly 2 hours for our to go order to be filled. I am also not a fan of eating out of a box when I sit down to eat. Disposing of all of that styrofoam daily is definitely not good for the environment. Over all: clean environment, spotty service, decent food, get some real plates please.

aAsLrNxq2lKwXNc2XeCwnA.text: This place is ABSOLUTE LOVE!!! I just moved back to the area from Maryland and I was craving seafood badly! I heard many great things about this place, so I came here for the first time with my friend (who has never gone here before) and we lost our minds. So much food, very flavorful, and for a decent price. I plan to make it my mission to come back every weekend just for the shrimp/crab combo. Definitely makes any seafood platter I've had in Maryland taste like trash lol.

-R2sshPaqdbvzeL51Y7Jzg.text: The waitress was very nice and professional. This place is awful. First, we had a 45 min wait we expected that from reading previous reviews. But to wait 45 mins to get a table and another 20-25 mins to have our drink and food order  placed and another 8-10 to have the waitress come to tell you they are out of  legs we ordered 4 crab and shrimp platter oh and by the way they were out of sausage and dont substitute anything to replace them  each platter cost $25.00 dollars so you would think they would at least offer you a choice of more potatoes,corn or shrimp not. So I say all of that to say its  bad customer service all the way around. To advertise that you are open until 7 pm and run out of food well before then is crazy the kitchen staff should be aware off how much food they have and how many orders they can fill before running out of food basically you could have told us at 430 you were out of crab legs and we would have been on our way. I lived in Savannah for 15 years and loved the seafood from there so I was really was looking forward to some Good eats but I will wait until I visit the C-port and hit up David's Seafood never disappoints and much cheaper. I wish you guys the best but you have a lot of work to do before I would consider visiting your business again when you know better you do better! Poor Management!

kXuWYupYhpVtJWMn_HqIBg.text: Recent news Health Inspection June 2019 now 90 that is scary. Just visited " King Crab " and it was awesome. The customer service, food and even the bathrooms were  spot on top notch. spoke to management and found out they were in the planning stage to open a spot in the UNIVERSITY AREA North Charlotte. So excited   So sad to come to a business that really needs training on customer service. Starting with the Host being rude and not sitting empty areas causing a 1-2 hour wait. I've been a host before and didn't understand why so many empty tables yet a long wait. When seated we had to wait again no apology no formal greeting just a list of things on the menu that you are told they ran out oysters and chicken tenders. Now you wait for your food that is over loaded in butter sauce shrimp rubbery and mushy (that is old or reheated) and cold . Waited 40mins for cold food that arrived same time as my appetizer. Still no manager to ask how is the meal. Asked for crab cracker that I can tell was not washed and noticed it is shared by customers. I Spent a total of 3.5 hours and had to flag down a server to get refills several times. Lots of playing around by servers I heard one cursing to another. I became nauseous during my meal I couldn't even  eat it all. It's very sad because the last restaurant that was in that location had similar issues. Get it together seafood connection!

yNdJ1TVhd3cwKkcNCvQXrA.text: I'm new to the state and I picked this restaurant for my birthday celebration. We went on a Friday at 4pm. Paying for your meal before you sit down did throw me for a loop, but I wasn't deterred. I ordered the (steamed) Connect Platter [lobster and crab legs]. My friend ordered the (fried) C-Port Platter [shrimp, lobster, crab legs]. There weren't any disposable bibs; just a roll of paper towel on the table that you use to drape on your collar and hope you don't ruin your clothes.  My friend's fried meal came out first, and my steamed entree didn't come to my table until 40 minutes later! I, the birthday girl, was waiting for my food to come last. Almost a hour full of repeat excuses as to why she didn't know what was taking so long. Absurd.   The waitress assured me that my food would be coming out shortly about 4x. She even brought me a seafood salad with crackers during her 4th time to the table to apologize for my long wait. During her 5th visit to the table to tell me my food would be coming out next, I expressed how dissatisfied I was with how long my food in particular was taking. She apologized profusely.  The utensils they provide you with are the cheap and bendable buy-in-bulk plastic fork and knife/napkin/salt n pepper packet kind. The waitress also didn't have any crab crackers "because we ran out of clean ones". How does one break open a crab leg or pull out lobster from the tail with subpar utensils? No crab crackers for a seafood restaurant?!   Our meals tasted good but the slow cook time and lack of management and cut on resources was ridiculous. The way they drench the seafood in butter, you would think they would give the bare minimum of a disposable bib. The Instagram pictures will bring you in, the service won't bring you back.

EqXCRStfID30JmVz0Ru0YA.text: I know folks love to say..."well, I'm from ABC" or "I'm from XYZ" so I know tacos. I know seafood. Here's my homage to such:   I'm from Louisiana and I know to tell y'all.... 1) I don't care for poop in my shellfish. Deveined isn't optional and I generally roll with it outside of Louisiana. Even more accepting with small businesses. My point: they didn't DEVEIN the shrimp so that little BLACK line around the backside of the shrimp is POOP.   2) Alternatively, I've spent enough time in Wisconsin to truly and genuinely appreciate BUTTER over Margarine. Margarine is SYNTHETIC and since they dump a lot...and I mean A LOT on top of the shellfish - I would genuinely and sincerely advise: Order anything without the use of "buttah"   3) I won't go on about the service. I will congratulate these folks for setting up shop and outpacing the Indian restaurant that used to be here. I waited for 100+ reviews before adding mine in order to avoid lowering their stars.   4) Oh! And someone could lay off some of the salt on that fried lobster tail.  5) Clean up the snow crab legs or consider buying live crabs and killing them a certain way (as there are a multitudes) then the gunk won't be in the meaty area.  6) The potatoes I had were brown Russett not new red skin potatoes. I chalked it up to maybe that's their budget or how things are done around the Carolina's.   7) I don't need the boiled egg.  The sausage is pork based not wholly beef.   8) Glad I found it via social media and will try any place with a fried lobster tail.   9) Here's to hoping things really take off and then maybe we'll get True authentic Butter. Even the no-name HT brand over this margarine. :/

c_egji9sONxtT4bifExuzQ.text: Sooo I've never had a completely positive experience here yet I still try to keep giving them chances. It's either horrible service or my order is short of something & I had to end up waiting even longer than the hour I already have to wait to get it fixed, or they misplace my order. Well tonight was the worst, online it states the dining room closed an hour before and the grilled/fried side closes 30 minutes prior. So I showed up tonight at 7:45pm thinking I'd be safe because I'm ordering to go and not fried or grilled. I put in my crab order, someone walks up to her, she tells me she has to cancel my order and the only thing I can order is shrimp & lobster because they do not cook crab legs an hour before closing. WHAT?!?!?! She says they dont want to pull any more out. Seriously? That needs to be posted online and even at the door before people walk in. Further more it was over an hour before closing when I walked in. Now despite the fact that they dont devein their shrimp and the lobster is typically mushy,  I love this place for crab legs and shrimp when I dont feel like cooking it myself for cheaper at home. The sauce they use is pretty flavorful. But I think I'll find somewhere else after this. I've tried to order online at grub hub but before you even add your order to the cart they add an extra 3.50 for sausage that they dont do at the location. That's in addition to the high fees at checkout. Such a scam!!

-PKGgULaerMtrj9v43GJPg.text: Seafood Connection is def the most popular seafood spot in the Queen City at the moment. I'm so glad they have a full time home in the old King of Spicy spot on Albemarle.   If you plan to come try them out plan to wait. Whether it's to sit down inside or to order to go you will wait. The togo waits seems a little shorter of a line. On my visit I chose to eat inside. From wait outside til getting our food it was about 1 hour and 15 minutes. Everything is boxed togo which makes it very convenient.   Once you get inside you place your order with a cashier at a register up front. All togo orders are paced at the bar. Then you seat yourself and have a number that you place on the table. Once you sit your sever greets you and brings your drinks. Our server was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed.   Our fried order came out first and we were able to nibble on that until the steamed orders came out. We ordered the Fried Shrimp Plate, the Steamed Crab Plate, the Steamed Shrimp Plate and the Steamed Lock Jaw Plate.   The fried shrimp was really good. A lot of flavor and good amount of seasoning. The shrimp are also a very good size. My friends had the Crab Plate. They throughly enjoyed it but would have liked the crab pinchers to crack the shells and be able to get to more of the meat. I had the Lock Jaw Plate. It was very good. The lobster was delicious and I was able to dip the meat in the seasoned butter that was trapped in the shell. I added the season egg and it wasn't good. I would skip that. I meant to order extra sausage but forgot. Once we had started eating we noticed we didn't have any sausage with our meals at all. When we brought it to our server's attention he said they had run out about an hour ago. It would have been nice to know and perhaps given another piece of corn or something. My only other issue with the food is that all the season is on the outside of the meat which is in a shell. It would have been nice to have extra dipping sauce or seasoning for my shrimp and the crab meat. I did find some trapped under the corn but it wasn't enough.   Now there was a slight issue with the restrooms on our visit as well. The women's restroom had flooded and I was instructed to use the men's restroom. Upon entering the men's room there were 2 stalls but one didn't have a door and the other was locked so with that being said I didn't use the restroom.   Not sure if I will eat inside on my next visit or do togo but I'm sure I will be back to try the brunch and the sausage!!!   Seafood Connection  5546 Albemarle Rd Charlotte, NC 28212 Saturday April 28, 2018 6:30pm

ni5311K0PJIQ-dkDZldnuw.text: Not bad for a first visit.  We arrived right around 1p on a Sunday. The parking lot was already pretty full, but once we got inside we were seated immediately.  Our waitress, Brittany, was great. She got our drinks quickly and took our orders. She checked on us frequently and asked us if we were still doing okay.  We ordered steamed seafood -- the 'Shrimp and Crab Combo' and the 'Super Combo'. The food was very tasty. The steamed combos come with sweet corn (amazing!!!), baked potato, and sausage (both of our plates came with one very small piece of sausage). Definitely tear off a few paper towels before you dig in -- it'll get messy!  The sauce they pour over everything is really good; it's very salty (not a problem for me, but worth a mention!).  The main issue I had was that the food wasn't very hot. It wasn't necessarily cold, but it could have been warmer. Also, the shrimp were a bit soft (not quite mushy, but could have been more firm) -- I think I only really noticed that because of the reviews I read before we went.  Overall a good experience. Would return.

zbh03FCbu8-jE4vsduhNGw.text: Love this place!!! It's always busy but was seated with not much delay. The hostess was so pleasant and sweet. The food was great fell in love with the corn with the butter sauce, super tasty. Can't wait to go back!

Ek0zKAF44FKqjtgIYTEsvQ.text: My first time here. The food was very tasty, however, no silverware ! I ordered the shrimp pasta with crabmeat. I had to use a plastic fork! I asked for a glass for my drink, they only have plastic cups. My friend ordered the shrimp and scallops over a bed of crab rice. WTH! Plastic forks? I looked over at the next table and they ordered crab legs. They served it in a "to go" container ! All that money they charge for the food and they serve us like it's a food truck! Nah, I'll go back when they up their game.  2 1/2 stars.

fo3p-d2y7LpGlc_ENG0v_g.text: 3.75 stars, although having a shorter wait would easily push it to 4 stars!  A few things to get out of the way before I start:  1.) The wait will be long. 2.) It will likely be busy. 3.) You order and pay as soon as you come into the door, if dining in. If ordering for takeout, go directly to the bar area to order and wait. 4.) It is only open on the wknds, Thur-Sun.  Now onto the experience,.....the food was really good! I ordered the "C-Port", a steamed platter with a snow crab leg cluster, shrimp, a lobster tail, one piece of Rogerwood sausage and the typical potatoes and corn. I also ordered a side of the crab rice. The platter was full to the brim and packed with flavor, but would have done well to have a full link of sausage in it instead of just a measly half. I found myself wanting another piece of it. If you ask me they could have given half the amount of potatoes (which I ate none of by the way, b/c they were sort of an afterthought and weren't cooked softly enough) & another piece of the sausage. I would pass on the crab rice altogether, it was pretty lackluster and a bit dry,  although full of real crab. I have one MAJOR bone to pick with the seafood platter though, there was not an ounce of Old Bay seasoning anywhere! As a Philly girl, I don't understand seafood that isn't seasoned in part with Old Bay! Their seasoning is more garlic based and tangy. It was good, but man I was jonesin' for some Old Bay. I even asked the server for some...which they of course had none of.   The service was good as well. The wait after sitting down was long. It took at least 40 mins to receive my meal, and it still arrived lukewarm! But, the servers were definitely attentive and accessible and heated my food up promptly.   Overall, I can wholeheartedly recommend this spot. It will definitely take care of your weekend seafood craving!

9mVsRv8Jp85HU_y51tugbA.text: First time going, it was like an adrenaline rush fulfilled after finding out about the "brick & mortar" opening. Heard so many great things about the food, so my family and I just had to go. Food was great and loved the fact that there was actually some flavor on the shelled seafood, but after the first time, the second time wasn't that impressive. Don't get me wrong, there is some great seasoning going on in that sauce, but it may be a little too much of it. For the prices that you're paying, each customer should at least get some disposable gloves and a bib, which was not offered and when asked, was told that was not something that was available. Also the wait time is entirely too long and there is always something that they are out of.  Went on a weekend, during CIAA (which was probably a bad idea), and everything that was requested was something that they were out of.

PwGaXUL5onMjYFY8cfy18Q.text: We had been hearing about the Seafood Connection for months when it was at the old location. So we thought we'd try the place on a Sunday afternoon. The place was quite busy as expected. The staff was very professional and friendly. The wife had one of their steam plates with shrimp and lobster. It was just plain delicious. The butter sauce is so good you could probably eat it on popcorn or an old shoe! The fried shrimp was good as well. Tip, dip the fried shrimp in some of that butter sauce! The service was a little slow. But all in all, a great place to eat some really good seafood.

Parking lot had trash all over (plenty of staff standing around... just didn't want to clean, or no manager to direct them too).  Wait staff was abundant and polite though.  Food was hit and miss; crab legs were good, but shrimp was disgusting (on everyone's plate). Chicken was not cooked all the way. M1eNedND0orTkjraEcspZA.text: High expectations led to great disappointment at the Seafood Connection...upon entry, restaurant was about half empty. We were seated right away only to wait 10 minutes without any acknowledgement whatsoever from any of the wandering staff ( which seemed to include two boys about 11 and 14years old???). We went to the hostess stand to ask which server was supposed to be assigned to our table and wouldn't you know, it was the server chatting it up with the hostess. The sever came to the table at which time we were informed that their system was down and she could only take drink orders. After about another 10 minutes she returned stating their system was back up. We are at a seafood restaurant and their menu is 90% seafood but don't get too excited because They were out of scallops, crawfish, and oysters! What?!? We settled on lobster with waffle and crab cake grits. After having to request silverware and served plastic ware, the Waffle was rubbery, lobster was tasty, grits and crab cake were very salty. As we sat waiting and eating we saw one table bussed when the person at the table had ordered and excused herself to use the bathroom only to return to an empty-cleared table, additionally three orders were brought out to the wrong tables, by the way the area we were in had about 12 tables so that's an error rate of 25% in one hour! Perhaps they were better off as a food truck??? Will not be returning.

9e2gtb9CDbnoYjgVyA-oiA.text: it's okay...it's really overrated to be honest. i got the shrimp and crab boil. only 1 sausage came in the plate and it was mashed potatoes not whole ones like i was expecting...highly overrated not worth $25

aUTr-uEguQTZlvPsXemM0Q.text: I ordered the salmon plate with crab rice and steamed veggies. The order was fresh but the salmon was overcooked, dry and flaky. The crab rice was a mixture of old and fresh rice (hard rice grains and clumps of old rice). It was truly a waste of my $26 and my 35 minute wait time! Then hours later when I received my receipt via email, I discovered they added an unauthorized $1.00 tip. I lined out the tip on the receipt and put the total order at the bottom when I signed it. Tried to call and make a complaint but no answer. Sent an email and no answer. Needless to say, I will not be returning to this establishment. First impressions are lasting impressions!

h-i6SSo9D-34RqKCvOIBtA.text: Me and my wife just finished eating our take home plates, and I must say we both were throughly disappointed!!! I got the "lock jock" plate which is lobster and shrimp.  She got the Crab Legs and Shrimp plate. The shrimp were huge that was the only good part!! The whole plate was drenched in butter to the point where it was pouring out the sides of the container!  It was disgustingly sloppy!  No need for that much butter.  The seasoning that they use over the butter was salty!! This entire concoction was disgusting.  We're currently sitting in our living room nauseated and scared to move for fear of throwing up! To make matters worse we both ordered Sprites to drink,  I'll be damned if they didn't mess that up too!! Both drinks were flat!!! We poured them out after one sip! For the price this was absolutely the worse meal you can get! My advice is to take your $60 bucks and go to any other seafood restaurant in town!

tFadFzg8ox14VYm5MpNnaA.text: I absolutely love seafood connection. I love seafood so much! BUT I went here one night after work and the wait was extremely too long. I've been here several times before and never had an issue but this particular night was different. After waiting for almost 2 hours, I decided I wanted a refund. They proceed to tell me that they don't do refunds. SO you're telling me that I HAVE to wait when I DON'T want to?? What pissed me off more is you could clearly tell one of the employees knew some of the people waiting. So he would bring out their food so that they wouldn't have to wait. THATS what really bothered my spirits and made me want to leave. Overall Shika the owner was a wonderful person and I definitely appreciated how she de escalated the situation VERY well despite me choosing to not be so nice that night. But it'll probably be a while before I return. Great food and definitely better than any competition in Charlotte. The seafood salad is great too. Check it out just be mindful that there will be a wait.

_WVnMfAmmB3Syz2jk-aNjw.text: Amazing is an understatement. I am never disappointed. The best seafood I have tasted anywhere in and out of state.

LBhPUIt6p1_mwnFyVXWfxA.text: Love everything!!!!!! If there is a wait...its worth it! I hope they do get their own location, I hope and pray its not too far away when they do but I would travel for this!!!

mIS6qy1PQEtQzIB4IIPDeQ.text: I've had the pleasure of visiting SC when they were at the church on the west side and now operating out of King of Spicy. I have traveled up to 40 mins one way and waited up to an hour once for my food. It is absolutely worth it. I've never been disappointed and turned a lot of people on to them. I live out of state now but I  always make a stop for food when I'm in town.

fEJ-MgIICcaLKwgFM976ig.text: What terrible service!! This was our first time trying it as we'd been followers on Instagram.  My husband and I were the 2nd party to arrive on Sunday when the restaurant opened.  To start, the doors didn't open right at 11... okay fine.  We took a seat for a few minutes and got seated at the table around 11:15.  We ordered immediately when our 2 friends arrived around 11:20.  I noticed the server taking other tables' orders one after the other rather than going to put orders in in a timely manner.  It was about 15 minutes after she took our order that we saw her leave to go put the order in.  The 4 of us ordered 2 orders of shrimp and grits and 2 orders of chicken and waffles.  For over 45 minutes we waited for our food.  The server kept telling us it was coming.  We finally got our 2 orders of shrimp and grits around 12:15.  No chicken and waffles though... at 12:30 we still didn't have the other half of our order and finally told our server to just cancel it and bring the bill because we had to leave.  So only 2 out of 4 of us ate after being there for over an hour.  We asked to speak to management.  It took 15 mins for the manager to come to our table and it was around 12:45 when she arrived.  She apologized and said she removed the chicken and waffles. Well she should have considering we waited all day and never got it!  But she didn't comp us on the shrimp and grits for the huge inconvenience!   After we complained about it, she said she'd take off a percentage which ended up being $3 off per $18 shrimp and grits order that we wait OVER an hour for... overall what a terrible experience! She should have come to us comping us before we brought it up as a way to make up for the hour and a half that we'd been there with only half our food!  I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 just because the shrimp and grits did at least taste good... but it wasn't worth the price or thWe won't be back!

kxX0hC5GH3YEYmN9JxJZ5w.text: This review is customer service based only. This is not based on the food or quality of food.   Dear Seafood Connection Owners,  After learning of your restaurant and looking at a lot of reviews on Facebook, I decided to give your small business a try. Upon arrival, I noticed the parking lot had remnants of seafood thrown around. Specially, shrimp shells. As my husband and I proceed to enter the building, we were stopped by a gentleman sitting on top of the small brick wall. The gentleman asks us "do you have a ticket?"  We respond "no" and tell him we are just here to order food. The gentleman then advises that "the restaurant owners" are closed down for the night. I check my watch and notice there is still 45 minutes or so. As this conversation takes place, I am also noticing the gentleman is wearing a bulletproof vest.  Yes, a bulletproof vest, so I ask if he is a cop to which he responds "no, just security". My husband and I look in puzzlement, as we are thing " but this is a seafood restaurant"  what could warrant such protection, so we ask why are he's wearing a vest. The gentleman then explains you never know.  Hmmmm. We thank him and turn around to leave. I write this because it needs to be said. I have no intention of slamming the business to ruins.   WE MUST LEARN HOW TO DO BUSINESS!  One should never conduct their business in such a fashion that the environment is conducive for hostile behavior that ultimately requires military style management. I'm sorry, but no restaurant should have security in a vest. Surely you cannot expect me to eat here, as it is hazardous to my safety.  If this is required, you should rethink how you do the business that you do. This is a restaurant and not a night club. DO BETTER!!!  Furthermore, the cleanliness of your portion of the parking lot must be checked. It's just not a good look for business. I step out of my car to shrimp shells thrown in the parking lot. It's your business, so you cannot use the excuse of we are not responsible for the parking lot because this is a reflection on you. DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT!!!    Also, this business of creating an artificial inflation in the demand for your product by constraining business hours, product availability, payments accepted or otherwise will eventually cost you.  IMPROVE THIS!!!  In conclusion, I truly hope you consider what I have written and take measures to improve your business. Remember...small businesses are the heartbeat of America.  If this is your contribution to that heartbeat, one cannot expect anything more than confusion, blight and ultimate failure.    Have a great day.

kCL3EXCFkI3CyLiRyZngjw.text: Got work to do. This is not my first time here. Although, I don't come regular I've came a few times before. I Walked in and they were busy but not as busy as it was when I left l. I ordered  a crab and shrimp plate and a veggie plate. Cashier said about 20/25 min wait. I knew it would probably take longer tho.  After waiting about 25 mins I decided to add a shrimp plate. 10 mins later my shrimp plate came, and waited another 10 or so mins for my original order that was placed 35 mins prior smh but anywho, I check my food and knew immediately that the food was cold. I had to travel 20 mins so I didnt make a big fuss. My other food came and I left. Got to my car and dug into my veggie plate and it was also cold. I was not happy but didn't make a fuss about it either. But never in a million years should anyone be served cold food ESPECIALLY after waiting almost 45 mins! What are y'all doing back there in the kitchen to where people are being served cold food? I just don't get it. Plus I'm not the only one who has made this comment on Yelp. If I'm paying MY money AT ANY establishment whether it be at seafood connection, McDonald's, Firebirds, or Bentleys, I want HOT and FRESH food. I didn't feel like making a big fuss today because I did have about a 20 min ride home but if I were served this sitting down and it was cold I would have pitched a fit and sent it back....Immediately! PLEASE work on this and get it together.  Please recognize the issues and fix them. I know y'all have your ride and dies that will be down with you all no matter what, but not everyone expects mediocre food and service.

Onq-mp26fyO7JJiocnIQUA.text: The best hands down. There food never disappoints. I just wish they were open daily. So that I can get it anytime. Once you've tried it once you will definitely become addicted. Best seafood in Charlotte

JBT59nixoplRaVortVTGcQ.text: Let me start by saying I have frequented this "restaurant" MANY times. I have thoroughly enjoyed the food but after my last visit, will likely not return. For starters, they are only open on select days and is only advertised by social media. This past Friday they advertised that they would be open 12-8. My husband drives all the way from Fort Mill after work to discover a sign on the door that they are not open although they advertised that they would be. So I cut them some slack and saw that they would be open the next day. They advertised they would be open again this day from 12-8. I drive 25 minutes from the other side of town, arrive at 7:22 to be turned away by their security guard. I was told they don't take orders after 7:30. Not only was it before 7:30 it was before 8 as they advertised! Terrible customer service.

7RcPlJQUkVXgHa5W29E4Rg.text: Being a HUGE crab lover, I kept hearing rave reviews about Seafood Connection. I was told that their flavor and seasoning is to die for and this is absolutely True!! Whatever they use to season their seafood is heaven sent and you will not be disappointed. In addition to the flavor of the food, I consistently heard that their customer service was not the greatest. During my visit there on a busy Saturday night, I didn't have any issue with the customer service. My husband's carry out experience on a very slow weekday afternoon was much different. He walked into the restaurant and staff looked at him as he walked in the door but no one bothered to greet him and/or offer to assist him. I would suggest being prepared to wait as the restaurant is often busy in the evenings and especially on the weekend but the flavor of the food makes up for it. I'm hoping the customer service will improve in order to create an outstanding experience all around. I'm certain that, if they're able to change the community's mind about their less than stellar customer service, they will be even MORE amazing!! I'm rooting for them and hope that they stay around for a long time because the food is awesome!!

V8nAwlfNqnBhhe4IC-5gDQ.text: The pics that Seafood Connection posts on Instagram are enough to make you want to dive through the phone! In town visiting family and was told we had to try this place because everything looked so good. Unfortunately they have limited hours, being open on weekends only for the most part. This particular week we lucked up and they posted a pop up and opened on Tuesday. Hours said 12-until they ran out for we RAN over there. Let me tell you it was everything I could have imagined and more the food was DELICIOUS! I had the steamed shrimp & crab combo. It was about 10 HUGE shrimp, a crab cluster, 2 pieces of corn on the cob, potatoes and sausage. Everything was smothered in the garlic, herb butter sauce that I believe had fairy dust and unicorn tears in it. It was nothing short of magical! It was an insane amount of food and the price was on par with that. My family got a couple orders of fried shrimp & fries as well which were also delicious. Only thing missing was some cocktail sauce for the shrimp. The pop up day was take out only but it is a pretty large space to dine in. They did say that they will be moving into another space soon so hopefully they'll be able to expand their hours. I will definitely be back whenever I'm in town.
