KIPYbgEcTawTj4M0vXhgUw.text: I enjoyed this place very much. A good amount of food. Was told the wait was 30 to 45 minutes but we only had to wait 5 to 10 minutes. The food was awesome. Only bad experience I had was I almost slipped twice.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. With my girls

lnPDARnpf6xVYJvaJqTmDA.text: I haven't been to Seafood Connection since they had the food truck and at that time the wait times were brutal.  I arrived 10 minutes before they opened to a line of about 10 people already forming.  They opened the doors a little after 11 and only let a few people in at a time to order to eat in or takeout, they do not take calls so you will need to stand in line or come in to place your takeout order so I would advise to view the menu and know what you want in advance, however if you're going for brunch the grilled plates won't be available until after 3pm(at least that's what I was told).  I ordered the shrimp and grits and added crabcakes and a waffle to go, and by noon I was walking out with my order(I also requested light seasoning).  The shrimp and grits included some type of sausage and I would say overall it was amazing after I removed the sausage which didn't enhance the dish at all but took away from it with the weird taste of the sausage.  The grits were not instant but creamy and dreamy the way grits should be and adding the crab cake really sent this dish to over the top deliciousness.  The red velvet waffle with cream cheese was equally great and not average size waffle but a huge Belgian waffle..........have your pillow ready.  On a different day I returned later in the evening and a few things were already sold out....bummer(get there early).  On my third visit I had the grilled fish with sauteed veggies over crab rice, amazing from start to finish.  Everything was very tasty overall, minus the weird sausage, but be very clear there is still a wait, and it's very pricey, so if you're cool with that give them a try.

bVD8XitG9o7axFjFEKAPRA.text: 6/2/19 - FOLLOW-UP REVIEW   Will call the restaurant directly to discuss my previous issue. If the matter is addressed accordingly, the star rating will absolutely increase to 4!  I stopped for dinner tonight, 6:45 and given closing was at 7, I ordered takeout. I'll fast forward to the end...my last review urged everyone to check their orders before leaving...well they now instruct you to do so before leaving the building. Now let me back up a little. Today's order was PERFECT...and it confirmed that the last jumbo crab order that I gave the previous review on...I was gypped! Today's order consisted of 4 ears of corn, 2 crab clusters. beautiful potatoes, 1 sausage and 10 jumbo shrimp. The last order consisted of 1 crab cluster, 10 shrimp, a pile of almost mashed potatoes, 2 ears of corn and no sausage (and there are no substitutions). If someone from the restaurant reads these reviews; please know that I love the food...just think that my shorted order needs to be replaced...the next time my mother is in town because it was a Mother's Day dinner. One more thing: please review the takeout process. For extensive time periods, the takeout counter is unattended because the person is running back and forth to the kitchen. There needs to be backup to ensure that the phones are being answered and the carry out patrons are being attended to properly. Thanks for addressing these concerns. I live 7 minutes away and I want this to be one of my regular spots.

Lh8KW6p_lfHsypJTQcK5GQ.text: Went here during my visit to Charlotte. It mid afternoon on a week day and the line was out the door.   We were taking our food to go. 25 minutes later we get to the cashier to place our order. I realized why the line was so long, other than the food being delicious. No matter if you dine in or take out Everyone must pay first. No dine and dash here. Didn't take long to receive our food once ordered.   I ordered the shrimp/crableg platter!!! Yesss, the buttery goodness was more than i expected and able to eat. You get crab, shrimp, corn on the cob sausage and red potatoes. I was so full, i had to save the rest for dinner the next day.   I will be visiting again!! Hopefully, they'll have worked out the payment system by then.

ZBl_gXsVcfhOHEPlXsCJ8g.text: Online ordering system non-working, spent 20 minutes calling to place an order and I'm current standing at the bar where I have been waiting to place an order for over ten minute. Unless you have an hours of your life to devote to simply placing an order. I would avoid this place.

9iNMWr0NRHg1kVmM0-m0wQ.text: Can't say enough good things about this place. Oh my God it is so good, I ordered the seafood platter comes with shrimp crab leg customers oil sausage corn potatoes and a buttery garlic sauce that will have you licking your fingers all day. The weight on a Sunday can be lengthy so I do recommend you make a reservation if you can do so or try going sometime in the week. The staff is very friendly patient and kind the bathrooms are clean but there is a slight odor. I will be back to this place it's a very fine place to take a family wouldn't call it a first date or second a place but it's a simple night out type of joint for sure! I've only been once but trust me I'm going back again. Portions are huge and if you do a seafood platter it's honestly enough food for two people.

E8pNTmSANU9TNKXhDYZJXw.text: Worth every last bit of the price. That sauce is amazing!!!! The sausage, lobster, shrimp, even the corn and potatoes were delicious.

XAzVnvihYaYd7D0nSI05Ow.text: First, this restaurant is getting one star only because you have to add a star to do a review. We drove 1.5 hours as a party of 10 to celebrate a birthday at this restaurant and had a terrible dining experience.  Our table server had to be flagged down to engage in every part of our dining experience-- ordering drinks, getting refills, and asking for condiments. We had to send back a plate of broccoli because it had hair. Our check had 18% automatically added. When I asked to see a manager to have the gratuity reduced to 10%, we were informed that their system automatically adds gratuity. This fact is indeed printed on the menu, but if you've received terrible service (or even exceptional service), gratuity should be adjusted. The manager also attempted to defend the table server three times, and each time I had to restate that I could not be charged for past performance. On a positive note, the food was seasoned well. Still the customer service has discouraged our return.

YZ_7bQHUHdpoGszKwWgVIQ.text: It was cold in building!! Food came out cold as heck and they automatically charge 18% gratuity for 2 or more people.music was way to loud and very hood

xtL3gshhV0fq_RB5Mg-P3w.text: Over priced over rated!! I have gone several times  and each time I was given different answers on how they serve the food! The food is pre-cooked and over cooked! It's not cooked as you order!

HzACHBu-4wP_YQv48Rjf6g.text: Unfortunately I will NOT be returning to this place. I previously lived in Maryland and Florida and I have to admit that this is by far THE WORST seafood experience I've EVER experienced! I ordered the special with (1) cluster of crab legs and (8-10)jumbo shrimp steam pot. I got my plate and the presentation was normal however they brought my plate out in a styrofoam to go box versus an actual steam pot. I began eating my food only to find I had wayyyy too much seasoning salt on my food. I suffer from high blood pressure and I just couldn't bring myself to eat this food with this much salt.  The sauce tasted like a butter sauce with tons of lemon pepper in it, I'm a very plain kinda gal when it comes to my crab legs. Just give me a little salt and butter and we have a deal. I ate two crab legs out of the (1) cluster and I honestly couldn't savor the flavor of the sweet crab meat that I had been waiting for, it was more like I was eating a lemon with salt on it. I don't normally like to send my food back but considering the pricing (paying around $100), I kind of had no choice. I had to ask for the manager TWICE, the first time she sent a message through our waitress; I was told, "because I had already eaten two of the crab legs there was nothing they could do", even though I showed her the excessive seasoning and huge pinch of seasoning salt observed in one of the corners of my styrofoam plate (as well as all over my food).  Finally I was accompanied by the manager and seemingly she already had her mind made up that she was not going to be able to help me. I explained that I didn't like the seasoning sauce, and her response to me was "well that's just our signature sauce". I told her I wasn't warned about the amount of seasoning salt that would be present and she brought up the fact that I had already eaten some of the crab legs, there wasn't anything she could do, luckily my mother convinced her to bring another plate which I consider unnecessary. Because if I am telling her that I cannot eat my food like this, that should've been enough, I was offered another plate without the seasoning and it was a better temperature and no sauce, just butter on the side, OH AND BY THE WAY, THE CHERRY ON TOP WAS SHE DELIBERATELY BROKE OFF TWO CRAB LEGS OFF THE CLUSTER... talk about PETTY. I was okay with the meal but I honestly think I'll go elsewhere for my seafood.  Speaking of bad attitudes, the manager wasn't the only one... the two hostess in the front were very unpleasant. I walked in and spoke to them just to be greeted with a blank stare. Refrain from calling this establishment on the phone because I witnessed the phone continuously ringing; I asked if they had the phones for "call ahead/reservations" and the answer was a plain 'NO'. What Is the sense of having a phone and not ever answering it? I was also facing the kitchen and witnessed the staff eating in the back (with gloves on) and all within a few seconds, a staff member was wiping his mouth with the same gloved hand. Another staff member was observed walking out of the kitchen with her shiny, sparkly cell phone case. We all both know that cell phones harbor a lot of germs as well.   I'm highly disappointed in the service, the food and the very few options we had to choose from on their flimsy, dirty menu's that were half ripped and sticky with BBQ sauce from previous customers. And don't even bother doing any kind of substitutions, my steam pot came with corn on the cob, potatoes and pork sausage... I do not eat pork, my only option was to take the pork or not have it at all, ALL FOR THE SAME PRICE! They had no fried oysters either... the list goes on. Take my advice, and save your money. Do not come here. #wastemytimesunday

5MXWFWFJ6C4YSf1FJyqzJw.text: The wait is always too long. They seem to be under staffed. The wait for the food is long. Even though its good and well seasoned they should give you bread or something while you wait.

NM6k5tnKXNrJroKY_aHtjA.text: Food is great. Giving this place two stars for the service. You order everything && pay BEFORE being seated. Then you get to your table, a waitress comes over and gets the drinks for you. After that, you wait for your food. There was four of us in our party. My husbands food didn't come until after everyone else was FINISHED eating. No one could track down his order. Your waitress doesn't even really know what you ordered. There was no apology made, no offer to get the manager. The only excuse they could give was that there is a fried side and a steamed side of the kitchen. Yet, no one had any fried seafood at our table so it still should've came out at the same time.  The bathrooms were disgusting. Two of the three stalls didn't even have toilet paper. And as you walk your shoes make noise because the floor is sticky.  It's sad to have such great food presented in such a way. And since you pay first, they don't care and it shows. It's clear that they try to keep the overhead sooo low that they are actually losing business. A roll of paper towels on each table, pre packaged plastic silverware, food served in styrofoam and drinks in styrofoam cups sooo basically they don't have to wash or use any real dishes. And you'll never get a drink refill because you will never see your waitress again. They don't even have wet naps but everything is soaked in butter. Ridiculous. They're so focused on getting everyone to pay first but not focused at all on the experience. I'm sure the wait staff doesn't make anything in tips.

zvqSU_WoJtR47EVRWTRQhA.text: I drove 1 hour and 30 minutes from Greensboro just to try this place. I would definitely recommend trying their food, but next time I will order to go. When you walk in, either you go to one side to sit in or the other for take out. Either way, you're ordering and paying for your food right away. Oh and don't forget to mention if you want a drink because I had no idea to do this at the front. It was busy when I came, but I was able to find a seat. They have a dog on the tables that says 1 hour max for eating in customers...The place was hot and it felt like there was no AC, but the music they were playing was all the way up my alley! Our waitress wasn't the friendliest and didn't stop at the table much. The food took around 35-40 minutes to come out, but it was so delicious. I had the connect platter (1 cluster crab legs/2 lobster tails) for $38 and added on shrimp for $10. You get potatoes, two pieces of corn, and about a quarter of a sausage. You will be eating with your hands the whole time (not sure if silverware is even an option), so don't be shy! They have paper towels on the table for you. I won't drive there again unless I'm already in the area (just too far for me being in Greensboro) and although I loved the music, I did not enjoy sweating while eating, nor the service, so in the future I will get take out.

QfvXig5uc1FetWRTLTGDQg.text: When I first moved to charlotte I was pretty excited about trying this place because of all of the social media hype and might I say the first 2 times were wonderful!  but when the owner announced the change of location it's like the quality of food and effort went down a lot. I had it two times before they moved and was pretty disappointed. Very messy in the bag and the flavors weren't as tasty.   Tried it again at the new location and this was the most disappointing time. We barely had any of the sauce, my food was cold and the portions got smaller. Might've been too big of a step moving into that location because the quality of service went down in my opinion.  Sat there for 30 mins and waited for cold food. Maybe they've just been having bad days when i've been, but I definitely don't see a point in going back.

vGxr1EF2JpJx8XZp2skUCg.text: Yum seafood! We ordered the crab legs and shrimp combo that came with corn, potatoes and sausage. Full of flavor! I only wish I could get some spice but thats just me, gotta have extreme spiciness.  There's definitely a long line so plan accordingly, they do pump out quickly and only open Friday, Sat and Sun.

O4TO3VXtYUQ1L1-TO_tbMA.text: I was so excited to try this place because It has all the rave on Facebook. We waited in line patiently for two hours. Once seated we had to wait an additional hour to get our food. Needless to say when the food arrived I was no longer hungry I sampled a crab leg and it was so buttery I could not eat it.Everyone else at my table love their food but I am a crabby lover and it was not very impressed not only by the service but by the amount of butter that was on my food. I will not be trying seafood connection again but I pray that they continue to be successful and all that they do.

1SCGuyhNhHYOpopjFClMfg.text: This place was worth the wait!   I'd seen all the reviews and pretty much knew what to expect...there was going to be a long wait but the food would be worth it.   I arrived on a Friday night around 6:30 and the line was pretty much out the door. If you're dining in you order your food, pay and then take a seat. They also offer take out, you're still going to have to wait but you can enjoy all the goodness at home.   I ordered the Lock Jaw which comes with shrimp and lobster, potatoes, corn and a sausage. It's a lot food. I appreciate that they cook up all the orders fresh. When my food arrived it was hot and well seasoned. I loved the butter and flavor. Especially on the corn, potatoes and lobster. Yes, it's messy. But isn't that the point?!   Overall, it was a fantastic meal. I'd absolutely come back and try more items on the menu!   Don't let the wait...make you miss this local gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lock Jaw
Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lock Jaw

DKNx_KZvF1YlW3ruXcLfFg.text: I am sick of the reviews stating how much butter they put on stuff, look at the pictures before going...they drench the seafood in butter. I'm telling you this now, so if you don't like it, just don't go. Butter is good and this food is good. It's obviously not to have everyday.  This was my first visit here and it was a Friday night around 6:30. There was a line and we had to wait outside of the door for a bit before ordering and then getting a table. After being seated there was a wait for the food. Take a good friend and time will fly.   Everyone was friendly: the cashier and the waitress. The waitress came to check on us about 2 times. Everything is in styrofoam containers, which was fine by me because I knew it was clean. The restaurant interior was clean and very large. It does need some updating, but this place is not about ambiance.   I ordered the Lock Jaw: lobster and shrimp which came with potatoes and corn, oh and a tiny sausage. The lobster and corn was my favorite-delicious!!!! The shrimp was just ok for me. I would come back and order carry out next time. Also get more lobster if possible. I probably would not get the shrimp again.   This place is about experience and trying new things. At least try once, I'd only for the lobster...which you must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lock Jaw

QjZHXF9exbFE6ZaxWEx1sw.text: This was my first time here at the new sit down restaurant. I love seafood especially all of the seasonings like Old Bay and other great spices but this wasn't doing it for me. Now don't get me wrong  you taste the seasoning but only in the butter. Once you suck the crab legs or shrimp that's where it ends. Well do me anyway. The shrimp was very soft(slightly mushy) but the potatoes and corn on the cob was outstanding in taste. The sausage was also soft like it was a breakfast sausage. Also had some hush puppies which were not good at all. I loved the lemonade and sweet tea mix(reversed Arnold Palmer. At least I can say I've been there. Oh wait!!! The Lobster Tail was good

8yIyZeUW4wB_6q6U3x3Zgg.text: I always encourage people to form their own opinions . But I've been here 3 times . The first time they were out of things which was ok . The second time I waited an hour for a table and then they told me they only had shrimp left , but YESTERDAY? omg . We sat at our table at 3:15..... our server told us around 4:00 they were still waiting on the lobster . She said she was speaking with the manager about the wait . The manager never physically came to our table . We finally got our food around 4:45... my crab legs were ICE COLD. So we waited for the lobster while the other food sat on the plate ? They offered free seafood salad .. like no , we wanted our food . they took a measly 15 percent off the bill. A manager never came by , and we sat there while multiple tables sat down , ate and left while we waited on some damn lobster . It's too much competition for them to always mess up.   I'm done with this place .

khgukj_jJDhPJ_g5DjPjKA.text: I've tried the location twice because I am a sucker for seafood boils and there are not many in Charlotte. The meal comes in a to-go box which was weird, as most seafood boils come in a bag. The food was lukewarm almost cold on both visits. After waiting 30-45 mins you would think the food would be steaming hot. The seasoning is flavorful however very salty. The meal plus tax was around $28. I would say it was ok, but after 2 attempts I was extremely disappointed.

UM7i82KVrh4jtquO8tYqzQ.text: After stalking this place for the past year, we finally made a trip to this awesome seafood place.  The photos on Facebook had been taunting me month after month after month with it's perfect looking seafood combos and lines down the street and around the corner.  But waiting in line isn't my style but now that they have this new location which is much larger, we made the trek from Ballantyne and had no problem being seated immediately about an hour and a half after opening. I ordered the shrimp, crab legs, corn, sausage, potatoes, hush puppies and fries and that sauce is just LIFE and makes everything taste delectable. I could pour it on my shoe and eat it!  The only thing I didn't enjoy was the shrimp. Some of them had a really weird taste and were mushy so I won't order that anymore but the crab legs were amazing and surprisingly the sausage! I am not a sausage fan but whatever brand/type they sell is really yummy.  Hubby, who loves corn, passed on it because it was overcooked and he likes his corn really firm and crunchy but that sauce on it is so good, I didn't care. They didn't have mayo for my fries so next time I'll bring my own and our table had to share a crab cracker but it's still not a deal breaker.  I look forward to going back and diving into this deliciousness again.  I think if you get there closer to opening times, there shouldn't be a wait. If need be, I'll update my review after my next visit but I'm sure I'll still love it.  That is all!

3i5GpwiQ3JldwfpuJpZqDw.text: I was excited to try their seafood because I've hear so much about it. Father's Day weekend in Charlotte for a track meet and decided to order. Got back to our house and was sadly disappointed... sauce was just thick butter, with garlic and salt and pepper. The corn wasn't cooked long enough, sausage was mediocre and the shrimp was over cooked. Oh, totally forgot to mention the potatoes seemed as if someone's grandmother grabbed them out the pot with her hands. Nothing about this place was good and I wasted $95 of my hard earned money here. We will not return. They need to take lessons from Shonuff Seafood in Durham.

AAMo7LTLejjPzcaxP4mICQ.text: I've heard this is some of the best seafood in Charlotte and after trying it, I don't disagree.   Our visit here didn't start out very good, but the food more than made up for it. You can either get your food to go or sit down. We chose to sit down and sat there for 15 minutes without anyone even coming to get a drink order. After the other tables around us were ordering, I finally said something and 5 minutes later someone finally took our order.   Unfortunately, they were out of a few things. We tried to get seafood salad and eggs, but they were out of both.   We split a C-Port which had shrimp, lobster, and crab legs. The shrimp were huge, but you did have to take the shell off yourself which was pretty annoying. The lobster was probably my favorite part. The crab legs were good, but I always think they're a lot of work for the amount of meat you get. They also don't have anything to crack them with which makes it challenging. The sausage that came with it wasn't that great in comparison. The whole thing is served in a pool of butter and seasoning. It was a lot of food, more than enough to split.   The amount of butter is any keto-eaters be dream. It was delicious and I would definitely go back.

6KfFM7UPQgEER6KiW6N7Bg.text: Ordered the steamed crab and shrimp special with the garlic butter flavoring. It came with potatoes, corn, and sausage. Also ordered the fried fish dinner. It came with fries and hushpuppies. The food was good but not great. My shrimp mushy and not clean but they replaced it with crab legs. The flavors were great. The fish was decent. Not really crisp tho. Service was great. My server was Jermaine. He did a good job. Not sure if I'd return. Could've just been a bad day but probably won't go back.

tw4j4AAgtR891Z_lgFtKkQ.text: Great experience. Great food!! I had saw this establishment on Instagram a few months ago and I wound up being in Charlotte for work so I had to stop by. I was already aware of the wait time. Very popular place to eat. I joined the wait list so it cut down on time. That was nice. I dined alone. I had the super combo and added 2 eggs. I felt everything was good. Only critique was the amount of corn I was given. 4 pieces. I would rather have had 2 and one extra potato and sausage. Overall great great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steamed Super Combo Platter plus 2 eggs

1jcVMPknaXzBA7nQI1k8mw.text: This place is delicious! I had read about how good the food was at this place and was really excited to see they had a new location that opened recently in my part of town. I was excited to go in and try it tonight, and the food did not disappoint!   A word of warning though, the place seems to stay pretty busy, so be prepared for a wait. We waited about 40 minutes, which isn't terrible for a Friday night, but you still should be prepared to wait. I asked our server if it was always this busy, and she said that it has been about every day. The servers and hostesses were all very nice, but because they were so busy, there were a few kinks in the service here and there. The food more than made up for it though. I'd recommend trying the super combo. It was on point!

oy5oBvl3_0EdvVk3NdtjiQ.text: This place is not worth what they charge. I ordered the crab legs and shrimp for 27 dollars. When I opened up the plate, I had 1 crab cluster and 8 shrimp. A third of a sausage, 2 pieces of corn and a half if plate of potatoes,  and not even red russet, regular old potatoes. I was and am still disgusted with the quantity of food that was given. This is not a place I would suggest.

NZGeQpLyjpIud0lH6xFixA.text: I have heard about the legend of Seafood Connection and came to see if it is indeed amazing. I have come to say...Its all FACTS. The location was great right off of I-85. Came with friends for brunch. Inside had a nice setup and was able to accommodate my party of 11(2 kids). The service was great by Brittany the waiter. The food came out in good time. Great portions for price. I had to really push it to the max to finish everything. Only complaint is usual with shrimp and grits I prefer the tails to be peeled off. Maybe for cooking purposes it is better though. Crab cakes was nice size and had good sauce on top. I will be back to support the black owned business :)

MhJtz8ooV9Sn9AJErTkkpQ.text: I would give five stars because the food and service was amazing. The one less star is for the long wait and awkward waiting area that looks like an abandoned bar. Prices are great, the sauce is everything.

GB2e1NwaIeJVFVrOAiFcHg.text: Very good sauce was on point! But so busy and I didn't get a call after I placed my order that they ran out of an item.  Great overall!

UE2R_VwnBEyJEOvnZHzD3g.text: Great sauce! I don't know what's in it but it's amazing. The price is ok some things can be a little expensive. The wait is entirely toooooooo long. The music is toooooo loud. The people that support the Togo line are rude and not pleasant at all. The shrimp are cooked too long. Most times I'm guaranteed some mushy ones. cTiaZetCZu2E26mVHTFmmQ.text: Food was great. We dined in and the wait time was about an hour for our food. When we received our plates the food was hot and fresh. vtqrb6hCPTdHr3w6OJfMHQ.text: Let me start off by saying this, NEVER AGAIN! When I went they were having a special on their select dishes. $20 for each plate. The restaurant was basically empty yet I had to wait 10 minutes to be seated. The inside didn't even look like it was done with construction. Once I get seated I notice the table wasn't clean and had to have the waitress wipe it down. Once I got my food it was lukewarm and the shrimp wasn't even deveined .  I don't know about you but I like my shrimp to be cleaned. Food came in a togo box which was weird and everything just tasted like butter, no other seasoning.

sWqTO-iYGLIAMvXdcyyxaw.text: The food is good  but the business it's self is unorganized and not very professional. I would come again but only when I have time and and patients,it's not a place I can frequent and I hate that

VYOnETAjXRPwde6suXKGkQ.text: This is the best seafood ,corn on cob and potatoes I've ever had ,this food hits the spot immediately, really addictive, finger licking good

sRDBQidOMD84qgvwKbu4gg.text: This was my second attempt at seafood connection. This first wasn't that's great. The second was disappointing as well. Went last night with a group and they serve your food in to go boxes and with plastic ware. Asked for real plates with the appetizer and when they arrived they were dirty. When the appetizer of wings arrived they were cold. Server took them back and when they arrived for the second time... surprise cold again. I ordered the steamed shrimp and crab combo that comes with corn, sausage, and potatoes. There was no sausage in my box. I asked the server and she said oh they told me they were out earlier. She could have told us that when they informed us they were out of some of the appetizers as well. The staff is disorganized but there were many of them. Our drinks came in styrofoam cups as well. Server did not offer refills once. Service and food could have been better. I don't think I'll give it another try.

zVh3Ert2u5P11_Jc6m0fmg.text: Always pleased with the flounder, shrimp or oysters. Friends have gotten the crab legs & lobster tail and loved it. French fries are ok. Hush puppies - well let's just say that Cookout has better hush puppies! Be prepared for a wait most times. Little pricey but good portions.

o35GqfdurUODqH3mVgPKmg.text: I rank this the best seafood I ever ate. They don't deserve the 5 stars because the ran out of food. But the food I ate was so good, it causes me to overlook every thing! I will return ever time I travel through Charlotte. "Put it on the list"!!!!

YzxTqMZPptreJ0E2-FmCCA.text: BEST SEAFOOD I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. The corn is amazing. Whatever butter sauce they have on the food is addicting. The potatoes are so good. Literally everything I had was amazing. I have no complaints about seafood connection whatsoever. I get the shrimp & crab combo. It was around $27, but worth every penny. I'll definitely be back. I'd recommend to all of my seafood lovers.

h5OQtdcDNRwMyms06Yk0WQ.text: The absolute best!!! Best seafood in Charlotte!! That sauce...OMG!! Sometimes the wait can be a little lengthy but it is def worth every second!! I love me some Seafood Connection!!

3_tTK0VyoxK3g1CCuvZlow.text: I've been in Charlotte for a year now, and this place has been the talk of my coworkers. I took off work early to go there, since I'm not off on the weekends and we expected a wait due to what we've heard. The wait in line to order & pay wasn't bad for us at all. We received our food in a reasonable amount of time, I ordered the shrimp & crab combo and my friend ordered the C port platter. I opened my shrimp and crab combo to find it was missing the crab cluster lol, no worries I just let my server know and they brought out in about 20 mins, which was fine because I understood they were busy. We didn't get our bucket for the shells or bibs, but the food was SO good. They give you a lot, but that sauce is delicious and the food was fresh and hot!! The roll of paper towels on the table really did come in handy. I read a lot of people stating this place is pricey, but seafood, GOOD seafood is never cheap and I'd definitely go back and pay for this again!! The sweet tea was also perfect!!

sNRtYkl1bcNf2kZCp3zsUw.text: Ordered steamed shrimp. While waiting, I asked for a glass of water instead of soda. Water was so medicinal, mineraly, I could not drink it!  Shrimp arrived tepid in take out box and on top of potatoes with piece of corn.  There was so much 'butter?' or margarine? the shrimp (that needed to be peeled) slipped thru my fingers. They were cooked well, however. Potatoes were meh. Corn was good. Sauce should be a dip option! Potatoes would have been better whole baked or cottage fried. $20 to satisfy my need for shrimp not worth it. Won't go back.

1IgLieVOGdrARWOjFlnJXQ.text: I must admit that besides the friendly staff I was largely disappointed in my dining experience. One would expect food to come out hot, not barely warm. Rice was undercooked, it shouldn't be crunchy. Also I think the 1 hr dining limitations are absurd especially when the food isn't all brought out at the same time. Also today a friend I was dining with, they forgot something off her order, instead of just bringing it to her, they asked for her receipt to ensure she paid for it (insert eye roll). I wasn't a fan of the concept either of having to wait in a long line, then having to pay for my food, before I can even sit down. The flavor is there but work on making sure the food is served hot, this place is way too pricey to be served warm food, ensure tickets before they are brought out are properly filled instead of questioning patrons about the validity of an order issue.

mMelJ6P82J2hOTGTghRjag.text: Now, I must say I'm going to struggle putting this review together.  Here's why.  Food coma having just ate here.  Wow, the wife and I went out for a quick tubing adventure in Rock Hill and was driving back to CLT and thought, why not try this place now?  It was 2pm or so and the line was non-existent.  Order and out the door in less than 30mins.    Once home, cracked open the to-go container and the seafood heavens opened up.  First off, non-butter lovers, stay away.  Now that is out of the way, let me just tell you there is nothing not to love about this meal or any meal they offer I imagine.  I had the C-Port platter and nearly ate all of it in one sitting.  The lobster tails were some of the best I've ever had (no I don't live in Maine or whatever but I know good food).  Do yourself a favor and make your own connection with Seafood Connection, you won't regret it.

Ayz2KyPY9KDw0K15eZ41hA.text: Food was very good but the operation needs help! Our server was very good she was very nice and friendly. Looks like they don't have good leadership

J4HvpH8xuY5UnsECmsqvIg.text: The food was delicious! I decided to try this for a Father's Day treat to the Mister. He enjoyed every drop and loved the "sauce". The portions are generous. We had the steamed shrimp/crab platter (added extra shrimp) which comes with corn, potatoes, pork sausage and a side of crawfish. I highly recommend you giving them a try. The ONLY reason I didn't give them 5 stars, I didn't get the extra 2 sausages I paid for. I will be back!

GMas7ql5G-12-RIwEktaKw.text: Aaaaaaaabsolutely love love love this place! Food is always fresh and seasoned! Never disappointed!

7vPVY1OIgv6s-407V3z01g.text: Great food and HUGE portions. Nice staff. Music is too loud and it's too dark in dining room. With food this good I only wish they made homemade tartar sauce.

Ij-Q_73cWoASWnZVS6BFfQ.text: Just walked out of there.  The hostess couldn't tell me how long the wait is. Literally told me, "Oh, I don't know how long it will be." Who says this?!?!? I understand the food is good, but service like that, I will gladly take my money else where.

d_zz3LQB7jyNVfzWPnPF5g.text: I'm all for supporting black businesses and that's why I support over and over, but I don't think 8 will be back. 66680DB5VCUSrmoqXNLeDg.text: Came to pick up a prepaid order & waited 45 mins just to have them say they lost the ticket & had to re make it. Just horrible & a waste of time!

2Fd0ib1Kuhkc19440CHKcg.text: So apparently 11 a.m. is 11 everywhere but this place. Don't get there at 11 because you will wait until 11:15 for the doors to be unlocked( the person didn't even open the door). When we finally got inside, no one apologized or explained it. When asked how I was, I responded cold!! They don't make their own tartar sauce which at a normal restaurant doesn't matter, but at a SEAFOOD place it's little unsettling. The packets of tartar sauce were cute though. When the food came out, it really looked amazing!! I got the fish and shrimp combo. There was more batter than fish but it was kinda like having an extra piece. The fried shrimp, Ff, and hush puppies were good. The servers spent more time talking to each other than the customers. I suspect that they aren't working for tips. We had Brittany and she was actually really good!!  All in all, the food was good but the service was lacking. Fun time had by some.

g0pdoZ_hjecZtxRBGpB6yw.text: I think it's a little odd that the number that is listed, is disconnected. I wanted to call and order ahead so I wouldn't have to wait, but that clearly wasn't an option.

w7uonIkkvYujzS3RReRl5A.text: Don't eat here!!! You have to pay for your food prior to seat. Once you're sat the "waiter" get your drinks for you and your food order. Once you get your food, which the shrimp taste like fried chicken for some reason and the fish is just bread with no fish and no flavor. Food is just terrible and during service had to flag down multiple servers to get a simple refill is ridiculous. Don't eat here the money and service isn't worth your time, find a better seafood place to eat at that actually taste like seafood lol

lkR_MZ7aHP49hrqsnB1FBg.text: I have been eyeing this place for several months and finally made it. The food was cooked to perfection. I ordered the crab and fried shrimp plate. It was around $40. I'm so glad I got the fried shrimp wich was an extra $3.80 I believe. The service was pretty smooth I was in and out in 20 minutes.  I will defenitly go back to this place and I am looking forward to it becoming a sit down restaurant.

VpJBlFR_UrijKmMp5CTEXw.text: Done with this place. Gave it 4 tries. First time was when they were on Albemarle...take out only. I had grilled scallops and fish. It was OK....not worthy of all the raving I heard. Maybe because I am from FL and I know of no BAD seafood restaurants in Jacksonville. Even the ma and Pa restaurants are good. Second visit introduced me the 1.5 hour wait. Granted..this was opening day...so I forgave the long wait...lukewarm food ..and inflated price tag. Meal was not memorable.. can't even remember what we had for 70.00. Third time..called in order for lunch pickup. I should have known to check my order but I had limited time as I was on a 30 min lunch break. I arrived at the time I was told and had to wait 10 min for my order. I was Ok with that. But imagine my dismay when I opened my order to find that instead of the grilled fish and scallops I ordered...fish and shrimp...tiny sliver of fish and about 8 shrimp. No sauce. ..side of corn.28.00 lunch...oh and my shrimp salad I ordered was missing.At this point I was done with SC. But I decided to try one more time...because I believe in supporting Black businesses as much as possible!! We show up at 7pm for dinner The restaurant closing time is 9pm. And guess what? They aren't taking anymore customers. DONE DONE DONE WITH THIS PLACE AND WILL NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE. The food is not that memorable. Check out Harbor View if you looking for a real seafood restaurant.

9W2AN5FqB6kSF2t1gvoSFA.text: I saw this place on insta and really wanted to try it. But I've learned in the past to research new places before wasting my time or money. In this case, I'm sure glad I did. The dozens and dozens of recent reviews about the horrible service, long wait times and bad food has officially deterred me from visiting this place. The fact that the owner can respond to some of these reviews with an attitude "yup I'm that manager you spoke to" is so unprofessional and makes me not want to even attempt to try this place. Who wants to catch a nasty attitude when trying to get some seafood?? So many reviews consistently say it takes hours to get your food, and the food is consistently cold. Management needs to know their customers matter and it definitely will affect their business profit in the end. I will not be trying this place. Very disappointed

_yXyWiDcNxUMoFPNFKWeDQ.text: Long wait unless you get there early, not the cleanest, service was ok, and no alcohol.  With all that said, you go there for the food, nothing else! Steamed super c-port platter, was not necessarily a "platter", but more like a quarter half pale. Please before you go, look at the pictures, there's butter on top of butter over more butter, but they do it so well.  At the bottom, they use steamed potatoes as a base, then they throw in the lobster, crab clusters, shrimp, corn, more potatoes and sausages, all steamed.  Then they take A LOT of butter (maybe garlic butter), did I mention that they use a lot of butter, and pour it all over the top of all the other ingredients!!! And there you have it! If you don't mind getting messy, and can handle all that buttered seafood, this is the place to go!!!! It's not a place you can go to every week, but definitely put them in your rotation once a month. They do it right, it won't be the best seafood you've ever had, but what it will be, is SOLID!  You'll definitely get your seafood fix!

BNQG_izwMjrwlKNeBnQaJg.text: Came in town for the day to hang out with my girlfriends. She found this place earlier in the week and sent us pics of the food and we were all in! When we first pulled up, there was a looonnnng line out front which turned us away being that it was hot and we were short for time. About 30 minutes later, we see there is no line and decide to try again. We stood in a very short line, finally got to the front to order and it was very strange. You have to order your food first, find a seat and then they bring it to you. I ordered the scallop dinner with veggies and the crab rice. After sitting for about 25 minutes, our food arrives at different times. The crab rice was very salty initially. The scallops were cooked perfectly. After tasting my friends food, we all agreed it was overrated. Everything was salty. Would I come back if I was in Charlotte again? Probably not. For the price and the set up, it was a bit of a turn off.

8_6OXD8pxea79dTz8xmIyQ.text: Just tried to eat here and at 7pm on a Friday night the sign on the door said they are "closed for the day". Based  on reviews I've just read I'm thinking they're about to be closed for good....IJS... Good time to try Cheddars next door!

Sxz9BDvZidpibiFudRWW4w.text: I had an issue with my order back in August 2018.  I just happen to be on FB and I read SC post requesting everyone give them the opportunity to make things right by inboxing them opposed to leaving bad reviews on Yelp.  I simply commented and advised them that system doesn't work because I inboxed SC back in August and yet to receive a response.  The person requested that I inboxed them while she was online so I just went to the original message and sent them another one.  I only wanted to offer feedback on my order being wrong and I was missing an item which was an egg.  I ordered crab legs but received lobster and I included the receipts (not itemized) with pictures.  Keep in mind it's has almost been a year ago and I've been to SC plenty of times after receiving the wrong order.  The person from SC was extremely rude and asked me if I had a receipt I advised her to look at the message because it was included keep in mind this happened August 2018 unfortunately I don't keep greasy receipts for 8 months. She then examined the pictures and told me it was a shrimp plate. I got 2 orders look at the other  picture. She then offered me 1 crab cluster and 2 bucks for my missing egg.  I told her my egg was actually 3 bucks She then wanted to argue with me back and forth about a price.  I didn't want anything from them just providing feedback and she was extremely rude and defensive. I will NEVER step foot in that establishment again or refer them to anyone. Whoever is responding on behalf of SC definitely need to go to a professional to get training on customer services in the hospitality business.  I still can't believe it.

eNqpM_Vxl9UtThPK2xTV3g.text: They list all the items that are not available on the wall with the menu. This was my first time going here and I was just passing through Charlotte picking people up from the airport but it was totally worth it. This place will be packed when they finish the renovations to have a sit down place but for takeout yummy. I had the fried shrimp and fish platter and it was sooooo good I didn't even need Ketchup or any sauce. I also order the steam shrimp. They are very large and flavorful. Lastly I ordered the super combo with two clusters of crad legs and shrimp plus it came with corn, potatoes,and sausage  if you are second guessing this place give the a try. Please remember that they are cooking seafood so don't expect to get your  food in fifteen minutes plus with all the orders they have you mag have to wait a bit but it's worth it OMG.

ZVqtrtyvvw7ZUKCA_yTiKg.text: Website and yelp shows this location closing at 8pm. Arrived at 6:45 to find out they actually close at 7pm and they had already closed their dining room. There were approximately 30 people setting around their bar and lobby waiting for their to go. There was very few chairs to wait in and we attempted to set at a booth to which a waitress said we are cleaning this and wouldn't allow us to wait their to be seated. We couldn't order anything fried die yo their fryer being closed at 6:30 when the sign at the register said 8:30. I see this restaurant all over social media and people seem to really love it however being a responsible for a large business myself it's clear how much structure this place lacks including a lack of employees that care about the inconvenience of the hours being incorrect. Which by the way they know because they said "yes we've asked them to fix it"  Don't waste your time there are other seafood spots on Charlotte with better food and service

R_zoh_oQYg9_Wpi9gqGslA.text: Food is tasty.  I'm a pescatarian and was confused, as to why sausage was in a veggie platter?  Personally, I don't have a lot of time to sit around for 40 minutes so I tried to call and place an order.  No one answers at all and that is concerning for me.  I've asked one of the girls if they take orders over the phone, she said yes. No one seems to answer at any time.  I want to be a recurring customer, but I think they need to be much sharper and organized from what I've seen.  That could either make you or break you as restaurant.

BJi_2tEzqYriqNIrFuIHsQ.text: I got the large platter for my husband's Birthday... it was better than the pictures! It had lobster tails, shrimp, crab legs, potatoes, corn, and they even packed the sausage separately (he doesn't eat pork, but I do) and it was absolutely delicious! I wish I would've taken pictures but it was gone really fast! We will be back!!!

KRIQCx8yCk-UQo2F6guXCA.text: After following this company for over a year, I was so excited to FINALLY try a plate for my birthday. Unfortunately, I was greeted by the most rude cashier I've ever had the displeasure of encountering. This place is expensive, I paid $40 for one plate, I didn't mind the price but when you pair that with rude service it's simply unacceptable. I went for a special day, but left a bit let down with the service. The food was great, but I might have to figure out the secret sauce at home since I can't see myself paying for subpar service ever again.

-M59I1Nb2KxSeNpRQqrJBw.text: Word of advice....don't let the pictures fool you!! I'm so disappointed with this place. I heard high praise about it and how good it was. Living in Charlotte, I've never tried it but today I decided I would.....and they failed to meet my expectations! First off, I had more potatoes than food. If I'm paying that much, I want more of the entree instead of the sides. The food was so overpriced (one bunch of crab legs )! I don't mind paying for food, but it needs to be GOOD FOOD. Nothing tasted seasoned....the seasoning came from the "butter sauce" they use but once you peel the shell or casing away, you're left with food not seasoned or flavored. The shrimp and lobster were over cooked, you could tell by how rubbery they tasted. And the final nail in the coffin...my crab legs were ice cold! I live less than 10 minutes away and when I got home, I had to heat them up. I'm all for supporting small businesses, but this won't be a place I'll be back to visit or patron or even recommend.

_-53_x4MY3dudxEP0ujYNw.text: Can't get enough of this place! I've never had seafood like this anywhere. If you're a seafood lover, definitely check this place out...you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States

oj5x5pDWOj3yySQThSW_Hw.text: I've been going to Seafood Connection since they were serving at the church, but this was my first time visiting since they fully took over the restaurant, mainly because I live so far away and their hours are tough to fit into my schedule. I've always enjoyed the food, but this time my friend and I agreed that it tasted a little different. Not sure if it's due to preparing in much larger quantities. Still, we enjoyed everything, with the exception of another friend that wasn't very much a fan of the fried fish. The wait wasn't as long as I've experienced in the past, which was a plus. Overall, we were pretty pleased and will visit again sometime.

z2XAp6gpYGmKWUiYhwoqSA.text: Arrived and was told they had a busy 3 hours and was out of food. Food looked good on website. Customer service is lacking.

Itp0zW0fe3p6Y6WKu9tcBw.text: The WORST!!!! Tooooo much seasoning which makes the food super salty. I'm not allowed to get my food without seasoning we're told. Only options are light, regular or Cajun. Then they don't have unsweetened tea and do not hav any sugar substitutes. Sorry diabetics. We had a large party and did NOT get checked on and we're still charged 18% gratuity. We received nowhere near that quality of service. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else or cook it yourself at home. The potatoes were mush but I ate them to balance out the salty or so i thought. My daughter NEVER received her fries and I asked for them twice. And we had one crab cracker to share. With 4 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Super combo

Tv_g2fyTifRQcQNdH9o36g.text: Food is amazing, the sauce is soo good and they give you a good amount of food. It does get super busy here and the service is really slow and the waiters/waitress are okay, would recommend coming earlier in the day. Overall, food is delicious but service could be better.

pM0eI5GS83uhrKJ1J89tpA.text: The seafood was delicious and everything we ordered tasted so good! You have to try the fried lobster and the buttery corn on the cob was flavored to perfection. The portions were good-sized. We took food home so that's always nice!   The staff was so friendly but maybe could benefit from some training or direction. They're not unpleasant, just a little disorganized for the large crowds that rightly fill this place up! It was very difficult for our server to keep up with demands of the several large parties near our dining area.   Several people nearly slipped on the slick floors and the table was a little sticky.   I would definitely order to go next time, but yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States

-JNnr6WtXXInVCAwktzOLg.text: I wanted some seafood and as always, I started with my Yelp app.  I looked at several reviews and decided on the Seafood Connection.  Once I arrived however, it all went downhill quickly! The first thing I noticed was the parking lot was very poorly light. In fact there where parts of the parking lot that were pitch black.  Once I carefully parked my car I headed inside. As I entered the restaurant a guy asked if I was there to eat, and I thought he was joking because he had a chuckle in his voice as he asked me the question.  I advised that I was in fact there to eat and he laughed and said they were closed.  There were people all over the place, and I was confused, and I asked if he was pulling my leg or something, and got the same response "we are closed" followed by a laugh.  I then turned to the hostess and she said the same and laughed as well.    After having the same reaction again, she finally told me that there wait time was holding at 2 1/2 hours.  Now, why they couldn't have told me that to start with, is beyond me!  I understand having such a long wait time and making the decision to close, but not giving the reason as people arrive is beyond me. Not to mention that it is a terrible example of customer service.    I will NOT be back no matter how good the food is.  Terrible customer service tops possible fantastic food any day!

xy1256e8Yd1wnP20siHoww.text: This place has to have the worst customer service for the prices they charge. I went to get some crab legs with my family of 3. My son and I asked to be seated. We were told we would let be seated until our 3rd person arrived. The table size would be the same and there was no one waiting. I love supporting black businesses and I'm willing to pay more to support my folks but I won't pay a dime for bad customer service.   DONT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY HERE!!! Mr. 3's or King Crab will treat you better for your money.

iqhkbNgZgS4ONjE6VaOu-g.text: I give them 1 star bc of the wait to be seat and the wait for the food and the quality of the food. I ordered the fried shrimp, fish, and oysters. I also added the fried lobster tail. After waiting an hr for food ( waiter came out after about 45 mins and said they lost our ticket) my shrimp and oysters we cold. I sent them back and then they came out in 5 mins minutes but the batter was falling off the shrimp. I probably wont going back the manager took 15% off bill but I wish I had sent it all back and just left. It is what it is but i was not impressed. I wasted $60 on food. I would of much rather went to Bonefish and go a dine in reward credit opposed to wasting money there.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cold shrimp and oysters! Not worth $60!!

t4xPeOAIFQsKT7G4n-2moA.text: I was really excited to try the food at Seafood Connection after following them on Instagram for months.   My excitement was met with disappointment. After eating the food, I don't understand all the good reviews for this place. I am a seafood lover and basically eat all types of food. I am not a picky eater or a person that complains or write negative reviews, but I guess there's a first for everything.   My boyfriend and I ordered the Super Combos Platter, which is shrimp and crab legs with corn, potatoes and sausage and the Fried Oysters. We asked if they have bread. The server said no. So then we asked if there was anything that they served that can sopped up the butter or sauce from our entree. She then suggested maybe some hush puppies. We said ok.   We were served the hush puppies first. They were dry. The Fried Oysters were okay. Would have been better if they served it with a creamy side sauce. Then our entree came. It was drowned in a thick, SALTY (saltier than the Dead Sea) margarine sauce. It wasn't even butter. The outrage for a seafood restaurant to use margarine! There was one piece of sausage, which could have been cut into 2 pieces. Also, the potatoes were Idaho potatoes that looked like they were hand broken in half instead of cut with a knife. It just looked like strange odd shaped chunks of potatoes.  The service was OKAY. Server was nice, but not efficient. She didn't give us a crab cracker until my boyfriend asked for crab crackers - she came back with ONE crab cracker. What am I - chopped liver? Smh.  If you're a True seafood lover, I wouldn't recommend this place. If you like fake butter and extremely salty food, then maybe try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States

zYjQjR_-ci327Cl0uIzPOA.text: Visited the Seafood Connection for a Sunday lunch. The quick Trip to Charlotte turned into a whole day ordeal. We were told at the door the wait was 2 hours! We waited for about 1 hour and 30 minutes before being seated. The young lady who took our drink orders was very kind and professional but you could tell she was overwhelmed. The young man who took out food orders was all over the place! We ordered an appetizer that never came! We asked him about it, he disappeared and never returned. The young lady had to bring our food out by herself! I felt so bad but she handled everything well.  The food was outstanding! I ordered the super combo for $35 & it is worth every penny due to the amount of food you receive. Arrived at the restaurant at 12:15pm and did not leave until 3:30pm...again if the service was better I would highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Super combo with 2 crab clusters, 10-14 shrimp, sausage, 4 corn on the cob and potatoes.

BfFL_l6485YA8sr9eSUfYw.text: I have been following the seafood connection for a while on instagram. I live in New Jersey, while In Highpoint, NC for a couple of days We had to take that 1 hour drive and wait 30 minutes to try the seafood.  The food was AMAZING and I didn't even finish all my food, I love the fact that your food come in containers already so just in case you don't finish it makes it easier to take with you. Our waiter was amazing, the only thing we didn't like was that our food came before our appetizer. So by the time it came we just took it to go . Other then that next time we are in NC we will be back. If this post gets read please make a seafood connection in New Jersey. I would invest in this business as I can see it doing very well in any state it's located in.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster, crab legs, jumbo shrimp, potatoes, and corn

9kAibjwsQLl9hObruOZJhQ.text: Was delicious! I hear mixed reviews about this restaurant but being a small business owner myself I think it is a must try!! Second time going and the food was great both times. Was a little disappointed with the little sausage shown in the pic below that comes with the super-c port meal ($75) and considered ordering more but it had a funny after taste so I passed but the sauce was not too salty to me as others said that it was and the sweet tea was great too

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Super-C Super C-Port Platter

A-f_Yiw98Oh7uWtQnE3J7A.text: I was so excited when I first saw a sign indicating that this  restaurant was voted  "Charlotte's best seafood!" Wow, I was sure suckered.  My word. This is by far, the worst place I have eaten at in Charlotte. The dining experience started off unpleasantly when we were seated by the hostess. She made you feel as though you were troubling her just by walking in. The waiter couldn't be less attentive and our meal could not have possibly been the same meal others rave about here on Yelp. The food was far from "fresh and delicious," and I supposed the "secret spice" they are speaking about is margarine, salt and pepper. If this is Charlotte's best seafood restaurant, don't ever have seafood in Charlotte!  The super combo steamed plate was composed of dissolved, mushy shrimp, crab legs, sausage and potatoes. I could think of better ways to spend $35 than on this over cooked plate of slime. The crab rice? Save your $10 since there is maybe a morsel of crab at best in there! I couldn't even stomach the taste. The $12 fried oysters were over fried in their batter and the oysters themselves seemed rotten.   What a disappointment! Thank goodness we tried it out first before bringing guests. Don't be fooled, save your money!

GYO0e_HsbWXfnbcB-hinKQ.text: Amazing seafood quality!!! The sauce is good but it is too buttery for me. You definitely don't want to eat this every week. I have had lobster, snow crab, and shrimp here and snow crab is definitely the best! It was very sweet and juicy.

LMVgu_u-cCH7y0XTZ5pw-w.text: Just as good as everyone says it is. However, be prepared for a long wait time in addition to a long wait time to be seated. Usually packed. The food was delicious, however it was a little too buttery and seasoned. Will probably get butter on the side next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States

uWKsSa44WGDiBxZW2WDi1g.text: Let me start by saying that my husband would give this spot five stars BUT this is my yelp page so I'm gonna roll with four stars. We recently went here for dinner with some friends and were excited to see what the fuss was all about. I ordered the steamed crab legs and shrimp and it was pretty dang tasty. My husband got the steamed lobster tail and crab legs and raved about his. The service was great! It is a no-frills, good food kinda spot and I'm with it. There were only two things that would've made it better for me. I found the seasoning on the potatoes to be a bit too salty (my husband says that he thought it was perfect) and we all agreed that the crab was kinda hard to get out of the shell because it was slightly overcooked. We didn't get the perfect pieces of crab popping out but more of the shredded crab consistency.  That being said, overall - it's worth the hype and a good local spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and crab

QurxvpUStjSW-Yw1QfQlZw.text: I was kind of disappointed, I guess being from the down south near the LA, MS, AL gulf the food did not meet my expectations.  The oysters were over breaded, literally almost everything I ask for they were out of. They were out of broccoli, then they were out of eggs which is suppose to be included in one of the plates I ordered, but yet I can't substitute. there was a small piece of Sausage just to taste the potato were very mushy, but to me it's over priced.  This was my second time visiting tried giving them a chance but it's a no for me. Not for sure what was all the hype was about but food was just ok to satisfy your tastebud.

tP7Fq9sTh0CaH_h4BVybsA.text: First experience at this establishment; was highly recommended by family. We had a late lunch early dinner. Was informed that later in the evening and weekends there can an extended wait. We were seated once our entire party arrived. Service was expedient & friendly. The food was excellent and very well portioned. Kids meals were also decent. Would recommend getting the Super Combo of Shrimp & Crab Clusters which was more than plenty to share with kids & adults. Other adults got small  plates off the menu, Salmon & fried shrimp with no complaints. The butter sauce (unique & tasty) on the Super Combo was saturated over the entire dish, would probably get it on the side next time. The initial rating of "4" is because it was very cold, which was immediately noted in the entry hallway area. Will definitely return again!

kKi-APzYSjBwOjaMGsc_bQ.text: Delish! I was wondering how the store front location would compare to when they were The King of spicy but it was very good... Flavor seemed a tad different but def loved it. This is not a cheap place but it is definitely good quality seafood with great portion sizes. If you want some good seafood and do not want to spend the work making it this is the place to go!.shrimp and lobster was my favorite the crab legs were also good. The corn was my favorite side! The sausage was slightly soft for my taste but all of it was in the butter sauce so of course that made it amazing. The line was also much shorter than before. I recommend checking them out !

The texture of one was of mushed up chicken gizzards. They also were two different colors. It was also very salty. The fish "flounder" was the size of an iPhone 6. Actually the iPhone is bigger. The food was also soggy. Most of the seafood restaurants I go to drop your fish when you arrive to avoid it being soggy. The lobster tails looked as though they were missing meat. The hush puppies were dry and soggy. A total waste of money.

eY26qdH4fKynJ-m9JNyYXQ.text: I wouldn't recommend this place.   The place was dirty on the outside and first impression of this place was not welcoming. If it is dirty on the outside, I'd be skeptical about inside areas and food preparation procedures.   A lot of employees...standing around. Our waiter was very nice and made sure we were accommodated. I wish I could remember his name.   The food was okay. The shrimp was horrible! The shrimp was dissolving into a mush. They did bring new shrimp but the problem still existed. The crab legs were okay, minus the one I received seemed not as fresh as it could be.   While we didn't request it, they were nice to bring us new crab legs. I wish they would have refunded us and called it the day. I didn't want anymore food and/or it being wasted.   I did slip on the greasy floor and caught myself but that might be something to consider fixing. Yes, plastic warning signs that floor is wet were posted, but it doesn't deter the fact that the greasy floor needs to be cleaned.

wZv8KIZlakGYQMhSQLYlYQ.text: Seafood lover traveling the world for work yet blessed to enjoy amazing gems like this on the road salmon tacos x 2, fried shrimp dinner x 2, shrimp and fish dinner, and the yummiest crab plate I've had to date (and I cater crab boils myself I Florida so for me to take the time a rave on this review, just know!) the ONLY thing... one dinner of left behind as the order was a pick up order and we called for 2 hrs non stop and couldn't reach the store anymore    But this is a testament of how business they were that day cause the phone was ringing busy until they closed so still til this very moment I haven't been able to get the refund but honestly I totally forgot abt it and even thought I remember just now writing this review the food was so good who cares about the mission shrimp dinner at this point.    Def will be back for more my next visit to the city

JOXSZoadmw8e9fdMQhFaPw.text: My friend and I came here  about 2 weekends ago and just now getting a chance to review. We both been raving about it ever since and I keep looking at the pic I took of the grilled shrimp and crab legs we had! Totally delish!!!! Was worth the trip from Gastonia. Highly recommended for the quality and the price!! I'll make sure to get the crab rice and an extra plate when I come back.

j_1-z4a1_SKN-2ONDXvejQ.text: Wow!!! If you want fresh and delicious seafood, then you need to take a trip to this restaurant.  On my first visit I had a difficult time choosing from the many options.  I settled on the Steamed Shrimp and Crab Leg platter. It was served on a bed of potatoes with sausage and a side of corn on the cob dripping in a lemon, butter and herb sauce.  It was delicious!! My friend ordered the fried fish and shrimp platter!  Before she could take a bite I had one of her shrimp in my mouth. Delicious!!  Well seasoned and fresh!    Although the restaurant is more like cafeteria styled dining with your food served in to-go containers, very basic tables and chairs, the theme and the restaurants name was beautifully sprawled across the table tops and walls!  As for your food being served in to-go containers, a very wise move on the owners part.  The amount of food you receive cannot be eaten in one sitting.  Making the to-go container a necessity!      This restaurant is definitely on the top of my list and will be a regular stop for seafood!!       Unfortunately, I couldn't add a pic of my meal.  Not sure why!

Mind you we didn't have the food nor paid yet and the waiter said "oh we don't do cancellations" then he finally gets his food and the guy takes our money/card he wrung up my friend card for almost $200 then says it was a glitch we asked for the manager and he got her and never even came back to apologize! 6Icorc_jn4KEsZcybEPwzg.text: Good seafood for the price, follow their IG page b/c they sometimes post specials randomly.

QuO22W1Hd3HeplYozTA9vw.text: Although your food is DELICIOUS....this is the second time I have been here during your advertised hours only to find you not open.  Today I drove 35min from south Charlotte during lunch, It's 12:15, your hours are posted 11-9pm and your doors are still locked.

z_5yYqIeU7pFSJyltTf2ZA.text: The wait to sit and be served was about 30 minutes each.  There is nothing brought to the table prior to the meal other than the non-alcoholic beverages you order.  The food was worth the wait.  I had steamed shrimp and crab.  Husband had grilled scallops.  Quantity and taste were excellent.  Perhaps next visit will be takeout.

xNqCRqyD1DsWXhvMsSU-xA.text: should had known to walk back out the door when we all walked in on a Sunday for brunch and they had rap music blaring through out the restaurant, I said to the group of 8, are you sure y'all want to eat here! Took 30 minutes to get seated we arrived at 12:15 pm got seated about 12:45. Took the waitress 20 minutes to approach our table. We saw several wait staff standing around talking, bobbing to the music and singing. So we couldn't understand where was the team work at if they saw our waitress  haven't even took our drink orders yet, help your coworkers out!!! We all ordered something simple since we already been there for over an hour. Ordered the shrimp and grits about 6 of us and the other 2 ordered fried fish plates. Simple, we thought at 2:15pm, we still had not received our food, couple of the guest asked for lemons for their water or tea, took her 30 minutes to bring lemons. We just ended up leaving offered to pay for our drinks the manager on duty who was so busy talking to some folks she must have known for years ignored my husband standing there for 10 minutes needing to speak to her so he heard the whole conversation which involved friend chat. She didn't turn around until I said out loud we want to pay for our drinks and leave please. 2:30 pm we leaving with no food and had to walk over to Cheddar's right next door to get some real service got there at 2:35 and the whole party ate and out the restaurant full by 4:00... priceless and the reason I be so skeptical about supporting black owned business!!!!!! the service always sucks!!!!!!!

01-mch4mlla4PQfwggw8Zg.text: Service was horrible, the waitress was always talking in a huddle with the rest of the staff. Always had to holler and flag her down. Food made me sick.  And the price is high for the worst restaurant experience I've ever had. Don't recommend going there!

Z1cTo0HLsj-lo4reR2zuUg.text: Well as it was my first time going I was super excited because I've heard so many things . I arrived with my girlfriend we ordered our food at the same time ,hers came out first . After waiting ten minutes the waiter came to tell me that it would be a few more minutes because it was Togo orders before mine (wasn't happy about that but ok) the waiter was nice he brung me French fries while I waited . 20 minutes later still no food my girlfriend has now finished her food ! Some date I finally received my food after 30 minutes and it was somehow cold  seems like a great place my girlfriends food was great .maybe it was just a bad day but for the prices I expected more ..

MGy56cyFtP1fzNOLGwytxg.text: I am SO OVER THIS PLACE!! Save yourself a trip. There's always something ridiculous happening here! They're either Closed, don't have heat, don't pick up the phone, don't have scallops, don't have shrimp, not opening for a week, stopping the grill at 5pm... THE LIST GOES ON!!! Such an unprofessionally run establishment. Good food, but the SERVICE and CONSISTENCY both SUCK!!!! I tried them one last time, but the inconsistency and hood mentality has turned me off! Lb5r-oEySb8-MXXd3UpjMQ.text: Really good but not good enough to stand in some of the long ass lines that they have sometimes. It's like they have a cult following you have to follow them on Instagram or Facebook to know when their cooking. I get txt msgs when their cooking, don't ask me how I got on their list but that's how I know when their cooking. This was my first time here and I just ordered something simple thinking it wouldn't be a long wait but boy was I wrong. All I got was a fried fish platter with fries and it was still an hour from the time I walked in the door till when I walked out with my food. I was pissed about the wait but the food was good. I would go back again but I'm not waiting in that long ass line when I know other seafood places where the food is just as good and a little bit cheaper plus they offer better options like turkey sausage. This is not a knock on them but I'm just comparing.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried fish platter with fries and hush puppies. 3 or 4 pieces of fish. Very Good

b6_pbVjXqT7F-9hWLCC-1w.text: BLACK OWNED BUSINESS!! As an African American woman, I thoroughly appreciate these gems. Came here with two of my friends today. It was close to opening time so we were seated immediately. Our server, Desmond, was extremely warm and welcoming. I ordered the lobster tail and crab cluster combo. It didn't take long at all to get to our table. It came with a boatload of potatoes, 1 piece of sausage (which I was a bit bummed about), and two pieces of corn on the cob. The lobster tail was a great size! About 8oz, which is hard to come by when dining out. I will say, prepare to get messy!! All of the food was very well seasoned, and the dipping butter is actually on the bottom of the pail so it touches all of your food. I liked it that way, but if you're not into all of the buttery goodness, I'd ask for it on the side. Unfortunately, they did not have gloves, but we were provided with lemon scented wipes so it wasn't too bad. The wifi went out so the system went down for about 10 minutes while we were preparing to pay, but Desmond was SOOOO  pleasant, we barely noticed. Thanks for great service Desmond! And hats off to the chefs!

KYavPwWb9MH-WyZ7p1fEUQ.text: Found this place on instagram and I will travel for food. This was worth the travel time. Excellent food, quality of food, quantity of food and atmosphere. Will be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Waffle. So So Good!

lyt-HNp91EyobiqcL-wCiQ.text: The food looks and tastes good. My only issue would be the service component. I don't know if it's a lack of staff, or staff experience, but there's no reason that we should've spent over 2 hrs in the way we did. We were told the wait to be seated would be over an hour but were seated within maybe 10-15 mins. The wait times between when our order was taken, when our food arrived, and when our check was taken was the bulk of our time. I didn't sense a collective sense of urgency.  I'm not sure how they have the front of the house managed, but there should always be toilet paper in the restrooms. Thankfully I have the habit of checking before I go and was able to get paper towels beforehand.   I hope that the service kinks will be worked out in the near future because I think the food is definitely worth a try but I can't justify such a lengthy experience. ESPECIALLY when you have people traveling from out of town just to see what you're all about. Once the service matches the hype--they'll be golden.

M6BhVS6ek-UIomRM93qhkA.text: It was ok. Salty, over cooked, and not really nice customer service. I had the steamed cluster and shrimp. I really like my shrimp deveined...so I was biting lightly. The fired shrimp I tasted off others' plates was tasty, but came out after I had mine. Corn on the cob was overly cooked and seemed as if it sat for a while bc it had that skimmed top on the kernels.  The wait was long and that's understandable because it's a new location.  Was just ok!!!  I probably won't be going back, but glad I got to try. Wish them all the success and hope it gets better.

m0oKKjahR19aV3QCzDkdNg.text: So I decided to go to the Seafood Connection on a Sunday during CIAA weekend. The line was long as hell. So I waited to get inside. 1st let me tell you it was worth the wait!!! You can take it to go or stay and eat. They also have a bar for drinks if your sitting. I ordered the Super C-Port platter (fried), Crab Rice, Seafood Mac n Cheese & Season Fries. When I got home the food was still hot and you can smell the freshness of the seafood. The C-Platter had 2 Lobster tails, 8-10 Fried shrimp, 2 pieces of corn, potatoes, sausage (pork) & hush puppies. There was enough food for my wife and I to share, we both were stuffed when we were done. The food was absolutely amazing! Great place to eat REAL Seafood in Charlotte. A must go to!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great place for Seafood when your in Charlotte, NC!!!!

TNACCMZDVCpfFfVKVyDxJQ.text: Both restaurants are closed as of July 20,2018. Very upset after driving 1hour to get their.Yelp please let everyone know.

tYQzgi951DbE8rt3CygH8g.text: This establishment was NOT aesthetically pleasing to me. It didn't look to me as if they were remodeling, as stated in a few reviews I read. There was a slight stale smell in the room/building. It took me about one hour, from standing in line to actually receiving the food I ordered.   I ordered the steamed shrimp and crab combo, along with the fried shrimp and fish combo. The fried combo was seasoned well, warm, and edible, yet the fries were soggy. The overall combo wasn't worth the $17 price attached to it.   The steamed combo was the most disappointing. The food was drenched in a buttery, salty seasoning sauce. It completely overwhelmed the combo and my tastebuds. The shrimp were NOT deveined and had a strong odor. I was unable to enjoy the corn and potatoes because of all the sauce it was drowned in. The meat in the crab legs were good. Maybe if the shrimp were deveined and the sauce was placed on the side in a plastic ramekin versus all over the food, this could have been a decent meal.   Overall, my experience was not worth my time or the $45 I spent. This could have been an off day; but for the price, time, and environment I'm not willing to give it another chance. Also, I tried to call them but their mailbox was f
