TrKzq0Uv_Kr2OGV6OQKeIA.text: If you're looking for the best seafood in Charlotte this is the spot!  First time and certainly not my last ! The wait wasn't long at I got the super c port ! This is best seafood I had in Charlotte period ! I  They also have Crab rice which I'm definitely going to try next! GREAT MENU *Update* Came back to try the fried shrimp and It was the bomb! **

7OmPL7ZLklTQxObzHEXlJg.text: First time eating here and let me tell you.... when I say you get A LOT of food for the price, it's definitely worth it. I think the prices are fairly reasonable for seafood. When you Walk in they give you the option to be seated or to order at the bar. We heard before that the place is usually packed and they were not lying. The place was definitely jumping and we opted for carry out service instead of waiting an hour to be seated. We waited in line and looked at the menu. Everything sounded pretty good and looked to be reasonably priced like I said before. I ordered the "super combo" steamed and hubby ordered "the connect" with extra shrimp, steamed. When we finally got home and opened the boxes the food was busting out of them which is a good thing. Everything was covered in butter and I know a lot of people may not like that but we certainly did. Everything was seasoned superbly and we both were very satisfied with the portions. Neither one of us finished our whole plate and we will surely be having them for leftovers tomorrow. Overall from what I could see from the inside, the place was nice and clean and the customer service was good. Once we got home and started eating, the food was excellent we will definitely be returning soon although our food ended up being $80 for two meals LOL. All jokes but, seriously the food was definitely worth the $80.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. 80$ for both meals
Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Super combo

HCGwtVxRnn0GHdtVJ3fu_g.text: If you heard anything other than greatness regarding Seafood Connection it's a LIE.  Words can't describe how great this food was. I mean the corn on the cobb was amazing. Yes really even the corn on the Cobb was worthy enough for this review. My husband and I came in on a busy Sunday afternoon, gave our names and was seated within 15-20 minutes. I have been trying to make it here for many moons so I wasn't mad at a 20 minute wait. We dived right into ordering our food as we already knew what we wanted.   Disappointed they were all out of scallops and lobster tails, I ordered fried flounder and shrimp with a side of corn on the Cobb, crab fried rice and an amazingly large $10 crab fill up box ( that my husband and I shared). My husband ordered grilled shrimp and salmon that came with crab fried rice. Every single thing was phenomenal. I can see how someone may have mixed reviews based on the heavy butter sauce but if your not a heavy sauce person I would opt for no sauce or sauce on the side. Thank you Seafood Connection for catering to my seafood needs your food is amazing!! I'll be back for sure.

6E9AvGZVUDlFozt8BLC49A.text: If you love Seafood then this is the spot. However good food also requires good service which today was lacking. Shrimp & Crab combo- excellent seasoning that was well prepared. Only one thing was missing....they ran out of andouille sausage! That is a much needed and required part of any seafood boil. I had to ask for a substitute item since my waitress did not offer an explanation. After 10 minutes of asking around, I received 2 extra pieces of corn. 2nd item was the fried shrimp and fish. Our waitress didn't know what kind of fish and we did not want fish surprise the response was it was Whiting. It was under cooked as my sister prefers well cooked fish or cooked hard. Shrimp were just ok and the fries needed more seasoning and color. It was a 45 minute wait to be seated so our orders were changed to to go. They did not provide any ketchup for the fries and were skimpy with the tartar sauce also missing cutlery and napkins. A lackluster and dissatisfying trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled Fish and Shrimp Combo

mYOccK0uySY06uq-80lWow.text: Something in the sauce is Margarine...  I have stood in line for up to 6 hours when there was a food truck. I was literally one of the first customers. Now, I won't be going back unless someone else pays or come in town. The niche that was held has now expanded.  I ordered the C-Port and Lockjaw. I also got seafood salad, extra egg, sausage, corn amd shrimp and a fried fish plater...  None of the food came together. The fish was the last to come out. Understandably, as it was piping hot with steam. However, it was lightly fried with absolutely no seasoning. The person that ordered the fish tries to figure out why it would not be cooked/fried hard. It could have been because of the piping hot fish  caused condensation on the styrofoam box cause it to get soggy but I'm not sure. I had to ask for the extras that was ordered and the Lackjaw had absolutely no potato or should I say mushed mashed potatoes.   The sauce uses to be amazing. It was green and had the out of world flavor. Now, I can tell corners have been cut and the herbs are dried; taste lile Mrs. Dash...  The kids are joking in the restaurant, no professionalism and there's attitudes when you go to get ab to-go-order. I was so proud of Jamie for acquiring both his locations early and really pushing seafood but I feel that he's fallen off. I'm just really disappointed in the sauce. It was truly what set him apart from the competition.

tzM8D8l0vH_8sp_sf-Li9g.text: So i first had seafood connection when they were just a food truck. The food was so good, but required standing out in the heat for at least an hour. Once they moved to albemarle road, the wait time decreased some, but the atmosphere wasn't the best.   The other day I visited their current restaurant location in university and it was nice and well-kept inside. The current restaurant is a major upgrade and they were playing some great tunes. Definite great vibes inside. My sisters and I called ahead and were told our food would be ready in 20 mins. We got there about 35 mins later and our food was ready at the bar. I had the lock jaw with a lobster tail and shrimp. One of my sister's had the same, the other the crab plate. We also got an order of crab rice which is amazing. The food was good, not as good as the first time I had it, but that could definitely have been because it was no longer hot by the time we got home. I love the butter sauce, but my only request is for them to make sure there isn't a pool of it in my bag. Luckily, the cashier/bartender was super pleasant, saw our dilemma and immediately offered to give us a new bag. Customer service was good by this bartender/cashier. Wish I had gotten her name!

nGrKjzb8XOaHZwPi3eYclA.text: I have been looking for a great seafood place since I left Florida in January and moved to North Carolina and sadly this place disappointed me.   They had an amazing picture today of a tray of freshly made crawfish. So I decided to go in and order the crawfish. For 6.00 you get a pint so I ordered 2 pints. Then I added on 2.00 eggs, 2.00 potatoes and 2.00 corn on the cob. I asked for butter only to be told they had a special seasoned butter that they make there which was s tiny container of congealed butter that was over salted.   So 26.00 later I am at home and open my container of crawfish that you could tell was sadly microwaved and over cooked to the point they were rubbery. The only saving grace were the sides I ordered as they were good.  I ended up throwing most of the crawfish away due to the rubbery texture was horrible.   I wont be back.... but it was an experience and my hunt continues for seafood in Charlotte

xNnO5_kxbJSprXfwLwoStQ.text: This is definitely a place for sharing; If you can eat an entire serving of their standard "plates" at once then kudos to you sir or ma'am. Otherwise, you'll have more than enough for lunch and dinner for about two days.  Seafood Connection is located right off WT Harris right next door to Cheddar's. They have their own large parking lot. When I visited early on a Saturday, I was able to walk right to the bar to place my to-go order. Apparently, I picked a good time to go because the restaurant was pretty empty (this was just before noon on a Saturday, FYI), unlike how it gets later in the day.  I placed my order for a grilled shrimp plate that comes with crab rice and peppers & onions. The total was $21.65 (after tax). I waited no more than 10 minutes and my order was ready. They have a sign hanging up behind the register that urges you to check your order before you leave because there will be no refunds once you leave the premises.  Once I got home, I dug in and I have to say, I was not that impressed. Their famous seasoning was good but not great. I did appreciate that the shrimp were large and plentiful but I didn't like that they keep the shrimp shells on -- I know, I know the shells have all of the flavor but I could do without.  I think I should've gone with one of the platters that have a combo of seafood but I'll give one of those a whirl on my next visit.  Seafood lovers, this is definitely the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled shrimp plate with crab rice and peppers &amp; onions

OKuLwWE_VKN6orTRUgHjsQ.text: I have given this establishment a second, third, fourth, tenth chance because when it gets the food right, it's to die for. The wait time has improved tremendously.   The staff is thoroughly unprofessional. They have a residential phone line in this business with no call waiting, so the phone will ring endlessly with no chance of getting someone to pick up if they are using it. Sometimes they just aren't answering the phone and you can walk into the restaurant and catch the person taking phone orders off task.   I'm shocked that they are opening another location in South Carolina with their profits instead of investing in fixing the Charlotte location first.

ASd3_3XubWMPxBAroGfQ-A.text: Please read entire review...I believe in redemption!  I'm sitting here now waiting for a Super Combo. It's been almost an hour since I ordered so why not start on the review...I have nothing else to do.  I'm not sure why things are taking FOREVER and I've seen people who ordered after I did get their food and leave. Hmmmmm, I wonder what they ordered.  As others have stated, it's cash only. And did I mention, it's taking FOREVER to get my food? I'm praying it's knocking my socks off, and blowing up my skirt good because it's honestly the only way I'll drive all the way back over here again, EVER!  The woman at the register is very nice.  I'm done for now until my food comes out. I ordered my food at 7pm, it is now 7:59...received food at 8:18.  PLOT TWIST...  The food is amazing! It's almost 10:00 and I'm just able to get to it because I went to the gym to earn the meal!  Everything is seasoned extremely well. The usual drawn butter one would need for crab legs has no place with this food, it really is THAT GOOD! And when I opened the containers, there was a little extra for my wait...I'M NOT MAD!  So although I walked out thinking that I'll probably never return, I have had a change of heart. I'm hoping my situation was a one time thing and the next time I'll be happy with my total experience.

0VMFCw461qastOaBADdNvw.text: This was the C Port entree. Came with 2 crab clusters, 2 split lobster tails, 10-14 shrimp, 4 pieces of corn, 2 seasoned boiled eggs, potatoes and sausage. OMG, it was sooooo good! Easily he best seafood I have had!  This place is completely no frills. No wait service and all orders are to go. But, there are tables and booths so you can eat in. The only thing is that you will probably have to wait a while. The line can get long so get there early. There is a bar but it was not open when we were there. The food here was so good that everything else was a minor inconvenience.   Be sure to wear something you don't care much about if you order the steamed entrees. They come soaked in seasoned butter sauce and you don't want to miss that!

6nqcCIkeCPiB6JvCDnr7Bw.text: I want so badly for this place to do well, flourish and grow, but they seem bent on the opposite.  The food is terrific, but the "experience" is inconsistent.  Known for long wait lines, it's the kind of place where you have to make a conscious decision that the food is worth the wait before you even venture in their direction.  That's what I did today...I decided the food was worth the wait and waited an hour to place a to go order only to be told I couldn't order from the regular menu because it was "customer appreciation week".    It would have been great to know that before I went there at best, but at minimum, make it clear before people wait in line for an hour.  Going to this place is like opening a box of cracker jacks- you never know what you're gonna find.   But here is what is always clear- they simply DONT appreciate their customers, even during customer appreciation week.  And their employees aren't empowered to do anything but say "I don't make the rules" while the managers hide in the back and won't come out and address concerns. Good luck with your experience.  I'm done giving them another chance to drop the ball.

qr3JMZ_Wv6ZerT7Mdgqveg.text: Being from VA, where we take seafood particularly crabs, fish and shrimp VERY seriously, I've been hard pressed to find decent, if not good seafood here in Charlotte....until now. if56Ft5vKFCR0hSI6Wio3g.text: In love with this food!!!! The shrimp, crab legs, lobster, corn, sausage, potatoes all the way down to the butter!!! OMG!!! I want it every weekend and I save on buying lunch n coffee so I can eat here on Saturdays. Guilt free! The best seafood EVER!!!!!!

P7bmot_aIcdBGtc0RAS0_g.text: Poseidon smiles upon the hands that bless us with the aquatic cuisine at Seafood Connection. It lives up to the hype. On a Friday afternoon, around 4:30, I waited an hour and a half before ordering, followed by 10 minutes for the food to come out. Despite the time, it was love at first bite. This is great seafood. So good, I returned 5 days later for another round. The second visit, a Wednesday at 2:15, there was practically no wait. I was in and out in 15 minutes.  The food is seasoned to perfection with lots of butter. This is Not healthy seafood, so pack your cholesterol meds. Food is served in a takeout box, whether you choose to eat in or not. At first blush, the price point is on the high side, but compared to other sit down restaurants, your Red Lobsters and such, it's right on par. You're just getting better quality and tasting seafood here.  On my most recent visit I had the Super C-Port platter. It included 2 crab clusters, 4 - 1/2 lobster tails, 16 jumbo shrimp, 4 pieces of sausage, 2 pieces of corn on the cob, and what amounts to 2 whole potatoes. Enough to feed 3.   They should do a better job of stating how much of everything you're getting with each meal (i.e. "2 clusters" .... "16 shrimp"). The menu leaves lots of questions. As far as service, they're friendly enough. No one is bringing food to your table, so there's not much to judge by.  Some things to note: Cash only. Open randomly in no discernible pattern - check the IG or FB page for open dates, which are posted night before or morning of. Located inside of King of Spicy restaurant.  Thank me later.

U6WcBLWR1opKb6BtFi2Yyw.text: This is far and away one of the the best, most unique seafood set-ups I've ever seen or tasted.  If you haven't been or heard about Seafood Connection yet, lucky-for-you I went here, and am perfectly stuffed to give you everything you need to know from the Seafood to the Connection...  Parking:  Parking shouldn't be an issue, as Seafood Connection (SC) is actually housed in the same restaurant as King of Spice (I know it's weird), which is in a nice size shopping plaza off of Albemarle road.    Follow:  In order to figure out exactly whats going on, when there're open and what the menu offerings are, you've got to follow their Instagram page - seafoodconnectioncharlotte  Set-up/Ambiance:  DO NOT GO HERE EXPECTING TO SIT DOWN AND HAVE A WAITER COME TAKE YOUR ORDER.  This is not that kind of establishment. The best way to describe this place is to imagine the Soup-Nazis episode from Seinfeld, but for seafood.  For example, after checking their IG page and seeing they were opening at 2pm, I made sure to arrive at 12:40.  Yes, thats right, a 1hr and 20min before they actually started taking orders.  Trust me, thats the only way to go.  Upon arriving, you walk around to the bar area where they have plenty of seats, post-up, maybe grab a beer and watch the line grow until they start taking orders around 2pm.  Oh and once its ordering time, know exactly what you want, and have your CASH IN HAND.  That's right, cash only!!!!!  There's also an ATM located in the front lobby of King of Spice.     Food:  I mean its seafood, and some of the best seafood you are gonna find in and around the Charlotte area.  I got the C-port plater (crab legs, shrimp, and lobster tails - all steamed), with a side of fries.  Total cost - $43.30.  Certainly not cheap by any means, but of course you have to pay for fresh, quality, seafood, especially here in Charlotte, NC.  In addition to the crab-legs, shrimp and lobster, the C-port plater comes with 2 small ears of corn, a big, meaty, smoked sausage (thats what SHE said, hehe), and one whole white potato, all drenched in some secret, butter, seafood sauce!!!  So you are are definitely getting a bunch of food.  I really can't complain about any of the food items.  Everything tasted awesome!!!  Everything is made to order, therefore it takes a good 10-15min before your food comes out.  Service:  No complaints as far as the service is concerned.  There's really not a whole lot for the servers to do except take your order, and bring you a styrofoam tray bursting with fresh seafood.  If you like seafood, you are gonna LOVE Seafood Connection.  Just remember to bring plenty of cash and look for King of Spice (once again Seafood Connection is located at the bar of King of Spice, don't say I didn't try to tell you!)  My only regret, is that I am just now discovering Seafood Connection, I'll be back soon and I'll be doing unmentionable things to some seafood!!

tfhhA2SmouH-AlNZfmp4Ow.text: So this place is currently sharing a kitchen with the King of Spice restaurant (look for their sign when trying to find the place). I didn't understand the hype before today because my friend woke me up on a Saturday morning (grrr) to tell me that we should be ready to go once she got the notification. Again, I didn't understand the exclusivity but I figured "oh, what the hell" and gathered my life to get out the bed! Let me tell you... I'm not even mad! Lol   The hour of operations varies and they also operate on different days of the week because the kitchen space is shared. For the most up to date information, refer to their IG page (@seafoodconnectioncharlotte). The IG will also provide an update on what items aren't available from their menu for that particular day.   IF THE LINE IS LONG...STAY THERE! Seriously, it moves faster than any place I've been where the food is made to order! I will not disclose how long we waited because it varies day to day and I don't want to discourage anyone's tummy (but prepare to be patient for at least 1.5 hours). Also, they operate as CASH ONLY (no exceptions). If you forget cash then there is an ATM available... but save yourself the headache and just bring cash before you arrive. Also, the prices aren't budget friendly so check out the menu before you offer to pick up plates for others! BUT IT'S WORTH IT (my pregnant friend gave it the motherly stamp of approval since she still had food left over).   The customer service is wonderful and even though the people behind you will want you to rush, the cashier will be friendly and helpful (in no way am I condoning that you take your sweet time though, lol).   All in all.... I will be back there!! Maybe sooner than later!

NBy4v5LqdI25lPNv42w55g.text: I've had this place bookmarked for a while and decided to come in.  It was a long wait outside the door so I knew it was going to be good. The line shorted for me once someone inside asked for takeout orders.  Inside was dim with sky lights used for lighting during lunch hours.  Gray walls and hip hop/r&b music playing.  Takeout orders were taken at the bar.  I knew what I wanted but waited for people ahead of me to decide.  Bad mistake because the wait was long enough.  I usually pay enough when I first try a new place but I wanted to be smart and not overdo it because it was a pricey spot.  Glad I did because I didn't care for my meal.  I got the boiled shrimp platter that came with potatoes and sausage with butter drenched over everything.  The potato was pretty much sliced open with shrimp on top, once piece of sausage, and two pieces of corn and little to no salted butter with parsley poured over it.  The corn was off the chain.  The shrimp didn't taste like the ocean or smell like it.  I only tasted one spot were salt was dashed.  I think I paid $17 and tax.  That's all I needed to pay.

7eiM8ZuaAYZc9mi0opVU7g.text: Dishonest! They will not refund a check, even if they are 100% at fault and unwilling to correct the issue in other ways.   We got takeout a little before closing. When we opened the bag at home, only half the order was present. We returned to the restaurant immediately to fulfill the remainder of the order, but the kitchen had closed.  Since they were unable to cook the missing bits, we asked for a refund on the order. Their reply was "We don't give refunds." This is unacceptable as this was clearly their mistake that they were unable to correct! We did not eat any of what they had given us. They still refused to give us our money back.  I ended up having to contact my credit card company and report fraud to get the (rather expensive) meal refunded.   Avoid this place if you value honesty and good business practices.

YE335x86CtXcAK2YpgvyyA.text: I loved this place. Social media can take you far when used right and I saw this restaurant on Instagram. The meat selections could have been just a tad bit more seasoned, but the sauce was so tasty it didn't even matter. I had the Super Combo and my friend had the C-Port Platter (both photos shown). The corn was tender and flavorful after it sat in the butter sauce. The crab clusters were steamed to perfection to the point where the shell was still firm and the meat slid out when you cracked it. The lobster meat melted in your mouth, as it should. The portions are appropriate, but I wished I had two pieces of sausage instead of only one. I'll also say I hate the fact the steamed shrimp still had all the shells on them. I would've been OK with the tail shell, but it made things very difficult to remove the whole shell with already slippery hands. If you're in the area, definitely go. I would definitely even suggest making a special trip if you can turn it into a day trip. Kudos!

jwPIXDhjk-6rlqut3NG0Zg.text: Seafood Connection lives up to its hype for sure. My brother and I wanted something different for Super Bowl Sunday and we both agreed on Seafood Connection. Luckily he was willing to drive all the way to the restaurant in the rain to pick the food up for us. They do not have a phone number where you can call in so you just have to pray they are not sold out of whatever you are wanting.  Luckily they were only sold out of fried and grilled food?? So we went with the steamed Super C-Port platter. Once placing the order the food was ready in 15 minutes. It may come in a normal size Styrofoam to-go box it is PACKED with food. A Super C-Port platter can definitely feed about 3-4 people.  The sauce in the box is what makes everything so good. I can not even describe the butter sauce but it is soooo good! The seafood is quality and hearty. They definitely do not give you small, skimpy crab legs, lobster tails or shrimp that is not worth the money. Everyone agreed the sausage was amazing and I am in love with the corn on the cob. Unfortunately they are only opened on Friday-Sunday but it is definitely worth making a trip and trying.

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Super C Port

WuWcz_F3xd9v7Yj2i8zoSA.text: Food was good WAY to costly for the service. Shrimp were over cooked and had to send them back and also we were give plastics forks and spoons. People were very sweet just wasn't checked on enough.

kQ_FJsBQ3Noxqer67YsY6g.text: I heard the all of the buzz and decided to check it out on my own.  I've heard the wait was an hour, cash only, shady setup, etc.  As I'm typing this even I wonder why I would subject myself to this place.   I trolled SC on Facebook for a week or so to try to see how the starts would align and allow me to subject myself to a train wreck of an experience.   Apparently the seafood is extremely fresh and is brought in from coastal Georgia.  They are only open when they have a shipment.  Sooooo, today was the day.  They were open and welcoming all cash carrying seafood lovin' patrons and I was willing to oblige.  I pull into the parking lot, walk into The King of Spicy, yes they are housed up in another restaurant, and follow the dry erase marker arrows to the bar to place my order.  Man, I must be livin' life right because the wait was nothing!  I waited in line about 3-4 minutes to place my order.  The lady taking my order was extremely nice and helpful.  She was quick but I didn't feel rushed.  Once I handed over the cash I was given a number and told it would be ready shortly.  Based on the number of people sitting around with that "I'm waiting for my food" look I didn't expect "shortly" to happen.  I decided to walk around for a few, check emails, blah, blah, blah.  About 20 minutes later, my number came up.  First, that's about the heaviest bag of food I've ever carried but once I opened it I knew why.  This plate was packed with shrimp, lobster, sausage, corn and potatoes all smothered in a butter sauce.  Put on a bib cause it's fittin' to get messy!  This was a plate full of happiness!  I would have been happy to wait that hour or whatever everyone else was saying.  The shrimp and lobster were well cooked, not rubbery or over cooked at all.  The sausage was a nice touch but almost a distraction of the main attraction - the seafood.

s6CUwcJkl0auxXthkLRjcQ.text: Sorry so unprofessional fryer was down couldn't get any fried foods I'm allergic to shellfish waited two hours for nothing I wouldn't waste my time they won't be in business long

cY2SQ3hzWTdEKKxw7NAZyw.text: The seafood is farmed-raised and taste synthetic. Dripping in butter, garlic, and herbs doesn't make a difference.

PiRoD365l9TyPCJ3NUXHvQ.text: I was in Charlotte for the NBA All Star 2019 weekend & I decided to visit this restaurant that I had been following for a while on Instagram. I figured since they have a huge following the food must be good approximately 77,000 Followers! Immediately when we arrived there was a huge parking lot which was great because it was super BUSY as we expected it to be! When we walked to the front door my friend & I were greeted by a very polite security who advised us for dine in the wait was going to be around 2 hours. We declined and said we want to place to go orders, he allowed us in and pointed us to the bar area. The line for the to go orders was wrapped around the entire bar but very structured. My friend and I looked over the menu, talked to others in line and enjoyed the nice music selection. We waited in line for 1 hour to place our order. I ordered the lock jaw plate which is supposed to consist of 1 lobster tail, shrimp, potatoes, corn.. I also added to my order a seasoned egg (2), sausages, 1 pint crab rice & an Arnold Palmer (half tea/half lemonade) to drink my total was $43. My friend ordered fried fish & shrimp her total was $20. After waiting 45 minutes her food was ready, my food however took 1hr & 10 mins to come out after ordering. So in total we waited 2hrs + to order and receive food. The staff at Seafood Connection advises you to check your food before leaving for accuracy. Immediately when I checked the rice I noticed it was very small but smelled sooo good! When I opened my lockjaw plate it didn't look seasoned at all it literally looked like melted "Parkay or I can't believe it's not butter" was drowning my food.. it really didn't look good but I figured because they were so busy and have a huge following I'm sure it's going to taste amazing. My drink was very good not too sweet but perfect blend of tea & lemonade. When I got in my car I opened my food and began to eat it... the rice was definitely the best it had a few crab shells in it but what do you expect with fresh crab meat. The lockjaw plate however was terrible it truly was not worth the money , the only enjoyable part of the plate was the sausages. Everything else lacked seasoning & the lobster tail was so small they cut 1 lobster tail in half to make it look like your getting 2, the corn was super sweet which I don't like. I understand it was a busy weekend for this business but even when i posted it on my social media some of my followers said they went there and did not like it either. Would I go back for the food? NO! But the customer service was amazing! I love seafood and they didn't live up to my expectation at all.. if you like long wait times, margarine sauce, pricey food this is the place for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Seafood Connection Charlotte  NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lock Jaw Plate which comes with lobster tail, shrimp,corn &amp; potatoes (at the bottom) I added on sausages and seasoned egg.

pjT5g6ADPv21y48Go0hQaQ.text: Straight to the point; they don't give you any sauce options which would be great if they did because not everyone likes butter as a sauce for steamed seafood. Which leads me to my point, the sauce was just SALTY (tastes likes ramen seasoning packets) mixed with pounds of melted butter. I have yet to try their fried menu. But if there was more sauce options it would definitely bring more customers.

fnhyn26U6h8IPopmPRS_WA.text: I was in Charlotte for a few hours and wanted to try some good food. Specifically good seafood. Someone suggested seafood connection and the pics looked so tempting i delayed my stay about 30 mins. The front door was locked but luckily, i saw a couple walk towards a side entrance and i followed. There is a sign stating they're under construction...not sure what the place was like before construction but i knew the food was going to be LIT as soon as I walked it.  You get in line to place your order, you're given a number then you sit and wait for your number to be called. I didn't wait too long(15 mins) before my number was called. I ordered the Steamed Crablegs Plate($30) and there was a thick ass layer of butter on everything i had a heart attack but who cares.  There is no place to sit and eat so it's all to go. I asked for wet wipes but they didn't have any and my container was so full, it wouldn't close so i knew I needed a lot of room(vehicle not sufficient) to spread and eat.   I drove back home to GA to eat. Quickly reheated everything and my goodness....I've never eaten that many crablegs and wanted more. The potatoes and corn were also delectable. The flavor involves a whole lot of garlicky seasoning and it melds so well with the tender crab meat. I have never been so sad and still hungry after a huge meal as this so I'll definitely swing by again next time I'm in Charlotte!

zwcUa3bgb8gI1D3JdFkWeA.text: Favorite spot to eat in the city!! Best seafood in the area!! Love the atmosphere here!!

GGA6DKiSFKf55c4k-LTNCw.text: I was so happy that seafood connection moved to university finally I don't have to drive so far and I can support a black business!!! Arrived at 4:30 upon entering the floor was so slippery we almost fell a few times and was walked to the back of the restaurant. when asked could we sit at one of the many booths we passed we were told no cause of the servers were on rotation. After refusing to sit at the table we were moved to a booth.... time to order!!!!! So excited then boom... No Scallops, No Crab rice, No crab salad, No deviled eggs, dirty silverware....Damn "what in the" seafood spot??? So disappointing!! Why even open!!! Have you ever had a taste in your mouth, whole appetite ruined!!!

9BstB5edsfiXQLu7I_3iVQ.text: Gave one star cause I couldn't give 0. Slow service. Awful food and sticky tables.  Don't believe the hype.

iOBYEXBu0r3v1T3sdzV9RA.text: I would love to try this place but it's not possible the line is so long even at 4pm a couple was leaving after waiting a hour already at 4pm we left again I guess its good?

5ETgAuZnTg18z9H5SiZhpg.text: I've been seeing this place in my Facebook feed for weeks. The pics are crazy delicious looking, the comments of glowing praise almost cult-like. I had to go check it out for myself. Is the hype real? Yes.   First things first, follow them on their social medias to see when they are open and what hours. It's kind of all over the place, and they could close early if they sell out of everything.  Currently, this pop up type business is sharing a kitchen with the Indian restaurant King of Spicy. When you walk through the door, KOS is to the left and Seafood Connection operates out of the bar to the right. There's a bouncer who greets you (why is there a bouncer? I have no clue). He'll point you to the line to place your order. I went the day before Easter at a random mid-afternoon time. There wasn't that long of a line. I've heard it can get crazy, crazy busy. So, just be prepared. I've heard it does move quick. Also, don't wait too late in the day in case they do get slammed and run out of things. I went with the Connect Platter (lobster and crab legs). Along with the crab leg cluster and lobster, it includes a piece of sausage, corn on the cob, potatoes and a couple deviled eggs. Total with tax was $30. This is a cash-only concept. There is an ATM at the restaurant.   Note: there's not a ton of places to sit here. They pack up the orders in a to-go fashion, I would plan to take it home and enjoy. If you don't like butter and seasoning, you won't enjoy this. It's not healthy by any means, but it's pretty damn delicious. Everyone here was so nice and it didn't take long to get my food. I will definitely be back.

oo_UXbzZIaJUIFYGHbDOHA.text: I haven't visited Seafood Connection since they moved to their new location, but I thought the food was amazing. It is a little tough if you don't have time because the wait is long. However, if you have a moment or two to spare the food is worth the wait. I think that the crab rice is hands down the best I've ever had and I got the fried flounder as well. I've been ranting about this place since then. Even their sides don't disappoint. Aside from the crab rice, the cord and potatoes are a hit too. You'll want everything. Do yourself a favor and give Seafood Connection a shot.

qQ1QRgRiZE4GAWA-BVFxaQ.text: I really wanted to try this place. I've been hearing so many great things about it. So we get there and the hostess is so dry. She proceeds to tell us they are out of half the menu. So we asked her well what do y'all still have left. She was no help at all. She said I mean crab legs. It's Sunday. I will try it again but the hostess definitely needs a new job.

lEyahEBBOjyfxccfohU8KQ.text: Food was GREAT enjoyed every moment of it... love we have a seafood place in Charlotte

fsizsAdzEqEkcFAqzKbrIA.text: We went to the restaurant over in the University area on a Saturday and expected a wait.  The first thing I noticed was that there were a lot of staff congregated around the hostess station when we arrived.  We had a party of 3 and were told 45 minutes but was seated within 20 minutes.  The wait came after ordering.  We waited over 45 minutes for our food.  I asked a lady passing by for a refill on drinks and  was told that the waiter would get it.  I asked passing by employees twice to no avail for refills on drinks.  Note that there were still staff hanging at the hostess station but I couldn't get a refill on ice tea.   We got the refill at the same time as our food about 25 minutes later.  We had steamed and fried items.  Both were barely luke warm.  The fried fish and fries were cold.  The steamed pot that contained shrimp/crab legs/sausage/potatoes etc. was cold.  Imagine the butter sauce had cooled and the steamed food was a cold grease mess.  I don't mind hot butter but hot butter was now cold grease.   This place left a bad first impression.

ZC2rRRuNNIFhwUe1HYN1mw.text: Good food but longer than expected wait for the food to come out. I understand why they dont take cards (after talking to an employee) but I still expect it for any place where the meal is over $15. I don't live in the state but I would definitely go back next time I am in town. Went on a Friday around 130 pm...only a few ppl in line ahead of me...got the fried fish and shrimp.

o3jgBfZ-cgXSjMYNdS6HCg.text: Amazing food! Ordered the crab cake and grits! Only down side was they had technical difficulties so we had to wait a little bit.

4gGeGW8gZxDia_Kn3iMGqw.text: This is one of the few restaurant reviews I have given. I want to warn you all but this restaurant is not what you would expect. My wife and I went to this restaurant for lunch after church on Sunday we were expecting and I sit down seafood lunch what we got was fast food added to the service at sitdown prices extremely high sit down prices the cheapest lunch was $12-$65. It took several minutes in a half empty restaurant for the waitress to come to our table and asked for drinks order. When she came back with our drinks they were in Styrofoam cups again fast food attitude. I ordered the two piece fish only option is flounder and my wife ordered the crabcakes and grits when I got my order approximately 25 minutes later it came in a plastic basket like you would get it Captain D's and my wife's game in a nice bowl at this time point we had to ask for silverware which took several minutes to get back while our food is getting cold. The slogan for this restaurant is it Hass to be the sauce I asked the waitress for tartar sauce and catch up while I got was tartar sauce catchup packets again fast food attitude. By this time I was very frustrated and asked for to go boxes before I had a bite. When I got home of the fish was actually pretty good and my wife's was not Her crabcake was not made from lump crab it was made from the same mixture you would get in at deviled crab entree. So if you're looking for a fast food restaurant service in a sit down restaurant with extremely high lunch prices this is the restaurant for you.

qlAvycIiJ4PYDLU2k-KCfQ.text: Excuse me while I pick my jaw up off the floor.  This is beyond "mid-renovation" this is your play-cousin trying to cater out of a closed down Alcoholics Anonymous meeting space.    Beat up.    Dirty.  Low lighting.  Taking orders from a fucking plastic card table like it's a garage sale.  No tables, a few folding chairs for the poor souls who are eating there.  For the price, I'd rather sit in a restaurant that is clean, ready to serve with cleanliness and aesthetics taken into consideration.  I'm shocked out of my mind that anyone would eat here.  This place is not ready to be open.  If you don't have cash to open a nice place, you can keep all the crab claws.  I'm not here for this, ever.

7UWHowWtiPnBB19IV2sLMQ.text: The food is great, however every time I place to-go-orders my plates are always missing something and they never apologize or give refunds. The wait time is also horrible.

It takes more than good food to make people keep coming back. I love to support black owned business and I am proud of them but this was unacceptable.

fgHYJaTnMkQNaYEY_dx_hg.text: First off, I would have given 0 stars due to the customer service.  This establishment is an example of why it can be challenging to support your own.  My BFF and I ordered our food over the phone to go since they're slow.. we're on our lunch break.  There were around 20 empty tables so we ask could we sit and eat instead .  A lady by the name of Kim told the hostess No and she'll come by to explain.. it took her so long to come to us that we left .  I'm trying to understand why we couldn't sit and eat when the food was purchased from them ???? I told my entire department about this .. this is my last time coming and besides I spent $30 for lunch !!!

aalfdS3NUnVsAY4FkvPt9Q.text: So since my comment was deleted on their instagram post I guess I'll share my review with my fellow yelpers...lol. The sauce is the best thing they have going. lFBK76bdvpSozecw6oQFDg.text: Food was good, but service was extremely slow!  I arrived at about 12:30 and left at 2:00.

L1IykkWEicWwRkvn6P1Vog.text: Heard great reviews on Seafood Connection. I went on 12/22 to order take out. I loved the vibe, atmosphere, & friendly staff. It took about 40 min for the take out. As soon as we got home we tried the crab legs & shrimp but was not happy. The shrimp were mush as well as the crab legs. The seafood did not seem fresh. Way to much butter sauce. I was advised the sausage was beef but definitely was not. I tried to call multiple times but no answer on 12/22. I did finally get in contact with a manager on 12/23. She was very professional & apologetic. She did advise me they ordered different shrimp then usual. She stated bring my receipt next time and they will replace the meals. I look forward to our next visit and will update review at that time.   ***Visit update 1/5 happy to say after a long discussion with manager she replaced all food. They would not do sauce on side but stated they can do lite. I am happy they made it right & for that I added 3 star review

CLG0uzsdZAfQWzuVVEHtSw.text: Seafoood Connection: "its something in the sauce" I'll tell you what in the sauce...butter and more butter. I've had better seafood in Charlotte. Long wait, poor customer service and food is meh. My boyfriend and I both got the c-port platter. His was deep fried  and mines was stream. We got home and realized they had forgotten the clusters of crab legs on my boyfriend's platter. Try calling them to complain...what do you know, the phone they had on their receipt was not in service. WTH? The potatoes with the steam platter was so mushy...you might as well be eating mash potatoes with your seafood. The sauce is nothing but butter. It was so salty I couldn't finish my platter. There was no dipping sauce for the deep fried platter. Wanted to try this place out because of the hype. Was so disappointed. We overpaid for a bad experience.
